name: Vanilla & Coconut Tarts
ingredients: 2⁄3 cup (70g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
2 tbs crunchy natural peanut butter (or other nut butter)
2 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Soak chopped dates in boiling water for 10 minutes, then mash with the back of a fork.
Line six holes of a standard 3 oz  (1⁄3 cup) muffin tray with baking paper or paper cases.
Combine date mixture, rolled oats and peanut butter and mix well. Divide among the muffin holes and press firmly into the bases.
Mix yogurt, maple syrup and vanilla and pour evenly over the bases.
Sprinkle over coconut and transfer to the freezer for at least 1 hour, or until firm.
Thaw for a few minutes before serving.

name: Mini Snack Pizzas
ingredients: 1 can of crushed tomatoes (14 oz can)
3 sprigs of fresh basil leaves picked & torn
3 sprigs of fresh basil leaves picked
preparation: Preheat oven to 390°F and line 2 large baking sheets with baking paper.
Combine base ingredients and mix well with a wooden spoon, or your hands. Form dough into a log about 12 inches long, wrap tightly in cling wrap and rest refrigerated for 20 minutes.
To make the sauce, spray a non-stick saucepan with oil and sauté garlic for a few minutes or until fragrant.

Add tomatoes and cook, crushing tomatoes with the back of a spoon, until smooth and reduced to a thick sauce. Remove from heat, stir through torn basil leaves and season with salt and pepper. Set aside to cool.

Cut pizza dough into 14 even rounds (about 1 1⁄2 oz ea) and with a rolling pin, roll to about 4 inches in diameter. Arrange on sheets and bake for 8 minutes or until dry and lightly golden around the edges.
Spread some sauce on each base, top with mozzarella, pepperoni and a sprinkle of chilli flakes. Bake again for 5 minutes or until cheese has melted and is lightly golden.
Top with basil leaves to serve.

name: Chunky Chocolate & Coconut Cookies
ingredients: 2⁄3 cup (150g) almond butter (or other nut butter)
1⁄2 cup (125ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
2 cups (270g) all-purpose flour (or gluten-free if required)
1⁄2 cup (90g) 70% dark chocolate chips (or dairy-free alternative)
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.

Place almond butter, maple syrup, coconut oil and vanilla in a small saucepan. Gently heat, stirring continuously, until just combined. Don’t overheat. Transfer to a large bowl and allow to cool slighty. Whisk in eggs, one at a time.
In a separate bowl, combine flour, cinnamon, sea salt and baking soda.
Gradually add dry ingredients to wet ingredients and stir to combine.
Stir through chocolate chips and coconut flakes.

Roll dough into golf-ball sized balls and arrange on baking sheet. Press cookies down slightly to flatten and bake for 10-12 minutes. Rest for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

name: Lemon & Raspberry Microwave Mug Cake
ingredients: 1 tbs maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Combine banana, maple syrup, vanilla, zest and egg in a bowl.
Add flour and baking powder and mix until combined.
Set aside 6 raspberries and fold remaining through the batter.
Divide batter between microwave-safe mugs and microwave on high for 60 seconds.
Top with reserved raspberries and microwave again for a further 60 seconds.
Serve warm with yogurt.

name: Fruit & Nut Bar
ingredients: 5 cups (500g) natural untoasted muesli (or gluten free)
3⁄4 cup (250g) honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
1⁄3 cup (80g) almond butter (or other nut butter)
preparation: Preheat the oven to 200°F and line an 8 inch square baking tin with baking paper.
Combine muesli and salt in a medium bowl.
Bring honey to the boil in a small saucepan and simmer gently for 10 minutes until reduced. Add apple sauce and almond butter and whisk to combine. Add to muesli and mix well.
Press mix evenly into prepared tin and bake for an hour.
Leave at room temperature for an hour before cutting into 16 even bars.
Store in an airtight container at room temperature for up to a week.

name: Apple Pie Oat Cookies
ingredients: 1 cup (100g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
1⁄2 cup (125ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup) room temperature
preparation: Preheat oven to 325°F and line 2 cookie sheets with baking paper.
Mix together oats, flour, baking powder, cinnamon and salt in a large bowl.
In another bowl, whisk together maple syrup, oil, egg and vanilla.
Pour wet ingredients into dry, add apple and mix to combine.

Roll mixture into 12 even sized balls and arrange on sheets. Flatten slightly with lightly wet fingers and bake for 10-13 minutes or until golden around the edges. Cool on sheets for 30 minutes before transferring to a cooling rack.
Store cookies in an airtight container for up to 3 days.

name: Pantry Honey Bars
ingredients: 1 cup (100g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
2 cups (300g) mixed nuts & seeds (eg almonds, cashews, walnuts, macadamia, pumpkin, sunflower, sesame, flax seeds)
1⁄2 cup (150g) honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
preparation: Line an 8 inch square baking tin with baking paper.
Mix oats, nuts, cinnamon and salt in a heatproof bowl to combine.
Place honey in a medium saucepan (not small, as honey will bubble up) over medium heat. Bring to a simmer and cook for 3-4 minutes or until honey is reduced by half and thickened.
Pour honey over nut mix and stir to coat.
Transfer to prepared tin. Place another sheet of baking paper directly over the top of the mixture and press evenly into tin. Refrigerate for 1 hour or until slice has cooled and set.
Cut slice into 16 even bars.
Store bars in an airtight container refrigerated for up to 2 weeks or freeze for up to 3 months.

name: Pizza Muffins
ingredients: 2 cups (270g) all-purpose flour (or gluten-free if required)
4 sprigs of fresh basil leaves picked & roughly chopped
preparation: Preheat oven to 325°F and lightly spray a 12-hole muffin tin with olive oil.
Place flour, baking powder, salt, garlic powder and oregano in a large bowl and whisk to combine.
Add ham, tomatoes and mozzarella and stir to combine.
Add eggs, buttermilk and basil and mix until just combined.

Divide batter evenly between muffin holes, top with parmesan and bake for 25 minutes or until golden brown. Store refrigerated in an airtight container for 3 days, or freeze for up to 3 months. Best served warm.

*To make your own buttermilk, mix 1 tbs vinegar or lemon juice with 1 cup of milk and let stand for 5 minutes.

name: Peanut Butter & Date Cookie Bars
ingredients: 1 cup (100g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
1⁄3 cup (80ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
1 cup (300g) crunchy natural peanut butter (or other nut butter)
1⁄2 cup (90g) 70% dark chocolate melts (or dairy-free alternative) melted
preparation: Preheat oven to 325°F and line an 8 inch square baking tin with baking paper.
Combine cookie layer ingredients in a bowl and mix thoroughly to form a smooth, thick batter. Spread evenly into prepared dish and bake for 15 minutes, or until golden. Set aside to cool.
At the same time, blend peanut butter, dates and vanilla on high until the mixture comes together when pressed. You may need to add a splash of water.
Press mixture evenly over the cooled cookie layer and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
Once set, drizzle over melted chocolate, scatter over salt and refrigerate for another 30 minutes.
Cut into 16 even pieces.
Store refrigerated for a week or frozen for up to 3 months.

name: Choc-Mint Energy Bites
ingredients: 1 cup (100g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
1⁄2 cup (60g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
1⁄2 cup (120g) almond butter (or other nut butter)
1⁄3 cup (35g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
preparation: Combine all ingredients in a food processor and pulse to combine and form a sticky dough, adding a little water if needed.
Divide mixture into 16 and roll into balls. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes to firm up.
To make topping, blitz oats and cocoa to a rough crumb in food processor. Transfer to a bowl and roll balls in topping mixture to coat.
Store refrigerated in an airtight container for up to a month.

name: Orange, Carrot & Ginger Juice
ingredients: 3 oranges peeled, quartered & white pith removed
1 tsp fresh ginger grated, or 1/2 tsp ground ginger
1⁄2 tsp fresh turmeric grated or 1/4 tsp ground turmeric
preparation: Blend carrots, oranges, water, ginger and turmeric in a high powered blender.
Divide ice cubes between glasses and pour over juice to serve.

name: Strawberry Ice Cream Pops
ingredients: 2 tbs maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: In a  high powered blender, blend coconut milk, strawberries and maple syrup on high until well combined, about 1-2 minutes.
Stir through chia seeds pour mixture into popsicle molds. Freeze for at least 8 hours or overnight.
Remove from mold when ready to serve!

name: Fresh Tomato Salsa & Beet Chips
ingredients: 400g baby beets trimmed, washed & thinly sliced on a mandolin
1⁄4 bunch of fresh cilantro (3 oz bunch) finely chopped
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F and line 3 large baking sheets with baking paper.
Place beets in a large bowl, spray with oil, toss and spray again to coat.
Arrange beets over baking sheets in single layers and season with salt and pepper.
Roast for 10 minutes, turn over and roast for a further 5 minutes until crisp. Chips will crisp more as they cool.
At the same time, make salsa by combining all ingredients in a bowl and season with salt and pepper.
Serve salsa with beet chips and yogurt.

name: Triple Chocolate Cookies
ingredients: 1 cup (135g) all-purpose flour (or gluten-free if required)
2 tbs raw cacao powder (or cocoa powder)
1⁄3 cup (75g) almond butter (or other nut butter)
1⁄4 cup (65ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
50g 70% dark chocolate (or dairy-free alternative) finely chopped
preparation: Preheat oven to 320°F and line a large baking sheet with baking paper.
Combine chia seeds and water in a small bowl and set aside.
Meanwhile, in a large bowl, mix together flour, cacao, baking soda and half the salt.
In a separate bowl whisk together coconut oil, almond butter, maple syrup, vanilla extract and soaked chia seed mixture until smooth.
Pour wet ingredients into the flour mixture and stir until dough comes together.
Add chocolate and cacao nibs and mix until evenly distributed in the dough. Rest dough for 10 minutes.
Roll heaped tablespoons of dough into 16 even-sized balls and transfer to prepared sheet. Press down very slightly to flatten the tops and sprinkle over remaining salt.
Bake cookies for 10 minutes. Cool on sheet for 10 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.
Once cool store cookies in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 7 days or freeze for up to 3 months.

name: Green Machine Frozen Bar
ingredients: 3⁄4 cup (90g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
1⁄2 cup (150g) honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
1 cup (40g) baby spinach leaves or kale
3 sprigs of fresh mint leaves picked
preparation: Place all ingredients except coconut in a blender and mix until smooth.
Once smooth, add the coconut and fold through with a spoon to retain texture.
Lightly spray 10 popsicle moulds (or ice cube trays) with oil and divide mixture between moulds.
Freeze for 4 hours before serving.

name: Quick Banana & Chia Toast
ingredients: 1 thin slice (1 1/2 oz) wholegrain bread (or gluten free)
2 tsp almond butter (or other nut butter)
1 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
preparation: Toast bread and spread with almond butter.
Top with sliced banana, chia seeds, honey and a dusting of cinnamon to serve.

name: Recovery Chocolate Mug Cake
ingredients: 1⁄4 cup (25g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
2 tsp cocoa powder (or cacao powder) plus extra for dusting
1⁄2 cup (125ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
1 tbs crunchy natural peanut butter (or other nut butter)
2 tbs Greek yogurt (or dairy-free alternative) to serve
preparation: Lightly spray mugs with oil spray.
Mix all ingredients, except yogurt, to make a smooth batter and divide between mugs.
Cooking one mug at a time, microwave for 1-2 minutes, depending on the power of your microwave.
Allow to cool for at least a minute before topping with yogurt and a dusting of extra cocoa to serve.

name: Chocolate & Salted Coconut Protein Poppers
ingredients: 1 cup (100g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
preparation: Heat a non-stick skillet over low-medium heat. Toast coconut for a few minutes until golden.
Combine with remaining ingredients, except cocoa, in a food processor and process to form a smooth dough. Add a little more milk if mixture is too thick.
With wet hands roll into even sized balls.
Place cocoa in a bowl and roll balls through to coat. Chill for 10 minutes before serving.
Store refrigerated in an airtight container for up to a week or freeze for up to 3 months.

name: Rice Cakes with Avocado & Tuna
preparation: Mash avocado with yogurt, lemon juice and chilli flakes in a bowl.
Add tuna, broccoli, scallion and pickle, mix well and adjust seasoning.
Spread rice cakes with mixture and enjoy.

name: Citrus & Maple Mocktail Spritzer
ingredients: 1 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
lemon or lime slices to serve
preparation: Combine juices and maple syrup in a tall glass.
Add ice and stir well to chill.
Fill glass with seltzer, add a few slices of citrus fruit and serve immediately.

name: White Christmas Slice
ingredients: 150g macadamia nuts soaked in water overnight
1⁄3 cup maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Line an 8 inch square cake tin with baking paper. (Spray a little oil in the tin first to hold the baking paper in place.)
Drain macadamias and transfer to a food processor. Add coconut oil and maple syrup and blend until smooth. Transfer to a bowl.
Add coconut, orange zest, puffed rice, cranberries and pistachios and mix well to combine.
Spoon mixture into tin and press down firmly to flatten.

Melt chocolate pieces in the microwave in 30 second intervals (or in a bowl over a saucepan with a small amount of simmering water, stirring) until just melted. It should be warm to the touch but not too hot or it won’t set properly.
Transfer to a piping bag, or use a fork, and drizzle chocolate over the slice. Refrigerate for 1 hour until firm.
Cut into 16 even pieces. Store refrigerated in an airtight container for 1 week.

name: Christmas-Spiced Chocolate Truffles
ingredients: 1⁄3 cup (75g) almond butter (or other nut butter)
1 tbs maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Process dates, almond butter, maple syrup, coconut, orange zest, spices and 2⁄3 of the cocoa in a food processor until smooth and combined.
Using slightly damp hands, roll mixture into 10 even-sized balls.

Roll in remaining cocoa to lightly coat, shaking off any excess. 

Store truffles refrigerated in an airtight container for up to 5 days.

name: Gingerbread Latte
ingredients: 1 tbs maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
ground cloves pinch or 1 whole clove
ground ginger or 1/2 inch fresh ginger, peeled & chopped
preparation: Add all ingredients to a small saucepan. Bring to a gentle simmer and cook 2-3 minutes or until milk is warm and spices are fully infused.
If using whole spices, strain mixture.
Transfer to mugs or glasses and serve dusted with extra cinnamon.
For a “red eye” latte, pour over an espresso shot.

name: Zesty Cranberry Sauce
ingredients: 1⁄4 cup (65ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Combine all ingredients except the orange zest in a small saucepan.
Bring to the boil, then reduce to a simmer, stirring frequently. Cook for about15 minutes or until cranberries have released their juice and sauce has thickened.
Stir through zest to serve.

name: Mini Cornbread Muffins
ingredients: 1 cup (135g) all-purpose flour (or gluten-free if required)
1 cup (250ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
2 tbs maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F. Spray 12 mini loaf or muffin tins with oil.
In a large bowl, whisk flour, cornmeal, baking powder and salt together.
In a small bowl, combine milk, cottage cheese, oil, eggs and maple syrup. Whisk well and add to dry ingredients. Stir to combine.
Divide batter evenly between loaf/muffin tins and bake for 18-20 minutes or until an inserted toothpick comes out clean and golden on top. Serve warm!

name: Strawberry Protein Ice Cream
ingredients: 3 medium bananas sliced & frozen (make sure they are ripe and ready to eat but not brown)
2 cups (500ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
preparation: Blend all ingredients, except fresh strawberries, until smooth.
Stir through mashed strawberries and pour ice cream into an 8 inch loaf tin.
Freeze for at least 2 hours.

name: Choc Chip Pumpkin Muffins
ingredients: 300g butternut squash peeled & diced (or use 14oz unsweetened canned pumpkin puree)
1⁄2 cup (125ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
1⁄2 cup (50g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
preparation: Preheat oven to 320°F and line a 12-hole muffin tin with muffin cases.

Skip this step if using pumpkin puree, otherwise place squash in a microwave-safe bowl, cover and cook on high for 3 minutes until squash is tender. Alternatively, place in a steamer over a saucepan of simmering water, covered, for 5-10 minutes until tender. Spread on a baking sheet or plate to cool slightly.
Blend squash or pumpkin puree with maple syrup until smooth.
Add yogurt, eggs, cinnamon and nutmeg and blend until combined.
Add flour, protein powder and baking powder and pulse until just combined. Mix through half the chocolate chips.
Divide batter between muffin cases and scatter over remaining chocolate. Bake for 20 minutes or until cooked.
Store muffins in an airtight container for 3 days or frozen for 1 month.

name: Chocolate & Peanut Granola Protein Bar
ingredients: 1 3⁄4 cups (175g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
3⁄4 cup (90g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
1 cup (160g) pitted dates soaked in boiling water for 10 mins
1⁄2 cup (170g) crunchy natural peanut butter (or other nut butter)
1 cup (160g) 70% dark chocolate melts (or dairy-free alternative)
preparation: Grease or spray a 8 inch square cake tin with oil.
Process oats, protein powder and salt together to form fine crumb.
Drain dates, reserving some water for later. Add dates to processor and blend until well combined.

Transfer dough to a bowl and mix peanut butter through by hand. Dough should be pliable enough to roll, like cookie dough. Depending on your protein powder you may need to add more oats if dough is too wet or some of the date water if too dry.
Add to cake tin, pressing mixture into the tin. Spread out evenly using a large spatula and place in freezer while you prepare the chocolate.

Melt chocolate in microwave in 30 second intervals (or in a bowl over a saucepan with a small amount of simmering water, stirring) until just melted. It should be warm to the touch but not too hot or it won’t set properly.
Spread melted chocolate over the protein bar base and scatter over the hazelnuts. Refrigerate until chocolate has set.

Cut into 16 even bars. 

Store refrigerated in an airtight container for up to a week or frozen for up to 3 months.

name: Protein Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredients: 2 cups (200g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
1 cup (120g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
1⁄4 cup (50g) 70% dark chocolate chips (or dairy-free alternative)
1⁄4 cup (65ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
1⁄4 cup (65ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
preparation: Preheat the oven to 320°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Briefly blitz the oats in a food processor, leaving texture and some oats still whole.
Whisk protein powder, baking soda, salt and oats together in a bowl to combine.

Add butter, maple syrup, milk and chocolate chips. Mix to form a cookie dough consistency. (Add more oats if too wet or more milk if too dry. This will vary depending on the type of protein powder used. Some powders are a lot more dense than others depending on the source.)
Once the dough is pliable, wet your hands lightly and roll into 12 balls.
Arrange on baking sheet 1 inch apart. Bake for 8-10 mins until golden. Transfer to a wire rack to cool.
Store in an airtight container for a week or frozen for up to 3 months.

name: Cobweb Dark Chocolate Frozen Yogurt Bark
ingredients: 1⁄2 cup (80g) 70% dark chocolate melts (or dairy-free alternative)
preparation: Line a baking sheet that will fit in your freezer with baking paper and spread yogurt over the sheet to form a circle.

Place chocolate pieces in a non-plastic bowl. Microwave for 1 minute, then 30-second intervals, stirring in between, until fully melted. Or place bowl over a saucepan with a small amount of simmering water and stir until melted.
Drizzle melted chocolate into a bulls-eye/dartboard pattern over the yogurt and then use a skewer to draw lines from the center outward until you have a spiderweb design.
Top with ‘bugs’ of chopped cranberries and pistachios.
Place sheet in the freezer for at least 4 hours, preferably overnight.
Break into pieces to serve.

name: Halloween Cupcakes with Plant-Based Dyes
ingredients: 1⁄2 cup (125ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup) at room temperature
2 cups (270g) all-purpose flour (or gluten-free if required)
1⁄2 cup (125ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
2 tbs (40ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
pink, yellow and green plant-based dyes
1⁄4 cup (45g) 70% dark chocolate melts (or dairy-free alternative) melted
preparation: To Make the Plant-Based Dyes:
For the pink dye, add beet and water to a blender and blend for 1 minute. Strain and pour into a sealable container. Store in fridge.
For the yellow dye, combine turmeric and water in a small bowl until smooth. Cover and store in the fridge.
For the green dye, combine spirulina and water in a small bowl until smooth. Cover and store in the fridge.
When ready to use, add dye a few drops at a time to your frosting or batter of choice! See how you like the color, and add more if desired.
To Make the Cupcakes: Preheat oven to 320°F and line a 12-hole cupcake tin with cupcake cases.
Add butter, maple syrup and vanilla to the bowl of a stand mixer and beat until pale and fluffy.
Add eggs, one at a time, until combined.
Whisk together flour and baking powder to combine. Reduce mixer to low speed. Add half the flour to batter, followed by the milk and remaining flour. Beat until just combined.
Divide batter between cupcake cases and bake for 20 minutes or until an inserted toothpick comes out clean. Transfer to a cooling rack to cool completely.

To Make Bats: Separate each oreo cookie and scrape out and discard frosting. Cut each cookie in half to make 2 half circles. Line a baking sheet with baking paper and place a teaspoon of melted dark chocolate onto the paper. Insert the blunt end of a bamboo skewer into the chocolate. Place the tips of 2 oreo halves into the chocolate on an angle to make the bat shape. Dip the candy eyes in chocolate and stick on top. Refrigerate to set. Repeat with remaining oreos to make 12 bats in total.

To Make Frosting: Place ricotta and maple syrup in a food processor and blend until smooth. Separate into 3 small bowls. Add dye 1 teaspoon at a time until desired color is achieved and frosting is still thick enough to hold its shape. Transfer to a piping bag and use to decorate cupcakes.
Insert a bat into each cupcake to serve. Store cakes refrigerated for up to 3 days.

name: Date Toffee Candy Apples
preparation: Place dates in boiling water and set aside for 15 minutes.
Strain dates, reserving the liquid.
Blend dates and half the liquid with coconut oil and cinnamon until smooth, scraping down the sides as needed. Transfer to a soup bowl and cool to room temperature.
Spear the apple with a skewer and dip into the date-caramel mixture.
Sprinkle over almonds and chocolate and refrigerate to set completely before serving.
Alternatively, for a more kid-friendly snack: chop apples into wedges first, and serve with caramel dipping sauce, almonds and chopped chocolate on the side.

name: Strawberry & Coconut Bliss Balls
ingredients: 1⁄4 cup (65ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
1⁄4 cup desiccated coconut extra for rolling
preparation: Place all ingredients, except the extra coconut for rolling, in a food processor and blend until fine and coming together. Refrigerate for 30 minutes to firm up.
Roll mixture into 12 even balls, then roll through extra coconut to coat.
Store refrigerated in an airtight container for up to 5 days.

name: Choc Hazelnut Protein Balls
ingredients: 1⁄2 cup (50g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
1⁄2 cup (50g) chocolate protein powder (or vanilla protein powder + 1 tbs cocoa)
1⁄4 cup (65ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
1 tsp cocoa powder (or cacao powder) for dusting
preparation: Place hazelnuts and chocolate in a food processor and blend until fine.
Add oats, protein powder and blend until combined.
Add maple syrup and coconut oil and blend until mixture comes together.
Roll into 10 even balls and transfer to a tray lined with baking paper. Dust with cocoa powder and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
Store refrigerated in an airtight container for up to 7 days or frozen for up to 2 months.

name: Cherry Nice Bites
ingredients: 1⁄3 cup (80ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup) at room temperature
preparation: Line an 8 inch square cake tin with baking paper.
For base, place cherries, coconut, chia and coconut oil into a food processor and blend until fine. Press firmly into base of the prepared tin lined.
For topping, whisk maple syrup, coconut oil and cacao until smooth and combined.
Pour topping over the base and smooth over. Scatter over shredded coconut and refrigerate for an hour to set completely.
Once firm, cut into 16 even pieces.
Store refrigerated in an airtight container for up to 7 days.

name: Chocolate Pro-Nuts
ingredients: 1⁄3 cup (80ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
2 tbs honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F and grease a 12-hole mini doughnut tin.
Whisk melted coconut oil, maple syrup and eggs in a jug to combine.
Combine almond meal, protein powder and baking powder in a medium bowl.
Pour wet ingredients into the dry and mix until smooth and combined.
Divide batter evenly between donut holes and bake for 15 minutes or until cooked.
Meanwhile, for the sauce, combine oil and honey in a small saucepan over low heat stirring until combined.
Stir through cocoa until combined, about 2 minutes. Remove from heat and cool for 5 minutes.
Stir through coconut milk until combined and set aside to cool and thicken.
Allow pronuts to cool for 5 minutes before dipping in sauce and sprinkling with shredded coconut to finish.

name: Iced Ginger-Turmeric Tea
ingredients: 100g fresh ginger thoroughly washed & roughly chopped
100g fresh turmeric thoroughly washed & roughly chopped
1 bunch of fresh mint (3 oz bunch) leaves picked
2 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup) (optional)
preparation: Zest lemons and peel or cut away the white pith and discard.
Add lemon zest and flesh, minus pips, with remaining ingredients to a blender and process until smooth. Transfer puree to ice cube trays and freeze.

To serve, add ginger-turmeric cubes, lemon slice, mint and some ice cubes to two tall glasses and fill with sparkling water. (Alternatively you can dissolve ginger-turmeric ice cubes in a little hot water first then add remaining ingredients).
For a hot drink alternative: add 1-2 cubes to a mug, fill with boiling water, stir and serve.

name: Turmeric Latte
ingredients: 2 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Mix spices, maple syrup and vanilla with a little hot water in a small saucepan to combine.
Add milk and bring almost to the boil. Remove from heat immediately and let sit for a few minutes for flavours to infuse.
Divide between glasses to serve.

name: Coconut & Key Lime Tartlets
ingredients: 3⁄4 cup (90g) cashews soaked in 1 cup water for 4 hours (or overnight)
1⁄4 cup (65ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
3 limes (or 6 key limes) zest and juice
1⁄4 cup (60g) coconut oil at room temperature
preparation: Preheat oven to 375°F. Line two 6 hole muffin trays with muffin papers that over hang the edge for ease of removal.
To make the base, place Graham Crackers in a food processor and blend to a fine crumb. Add coconut oil to processor and pulse until combined.
Divide base mixture between lined trays and press firmly into each case. Bake for 10 minutes or until golden.
Combine drained cashews, coconut oil, maple syrup, lime juice and most of the zest, reserving some to serve, in a food processor and blend on high until smooth.
Pour filling into tart cases, sprinkle over remaining zest and place in the freezer for 2 hours or until set.
Keep in an airtight container in the freezer for up to 2 weeks.

name: Choc Banana Espresso Muffins
ingredients: 1⁄2 cup (125ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
1⁄3 cup (80ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Preheat oven to 320°F and line a 12-hole muffin tin with muffin cases.
Place flour, baking powder and cinnamon in a bowl and whisk to combine. Set aside.
Place coffee and hot water in a large bowl and whisk until coffee is dissolved.
Add milk, maple syrup, coconut oil, vanilla, bananas and eggs and whisk to combine.
Add flour mixture and chocolate and mix until just combined.

Divide mixture between muffin cases and bake for 18-20 minutes or until an inserted skewer comes out clean.

Store muffins in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 3 days or frozen individually for up to 3 months.

name: White Choc & Goji Berry Cookies
ingredients: 3 cups (300g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
1 1⁄4 cups (170g) wholewheat spelt flour (or gluten free)
1 cup (180g) white chocolate chips (or dairy-free alternative)
3⁄4 cup (110g) goji berries or currants/dried cherries
preparation: Preheat oven to 325°F and line two baking sheets with baking paper.
Cream softened butter and sugar in a bowl with a wooden spoon (or use a stand mixer) until light and fluffy.
Mix in egg and vanilla until combined.
Combine oats, flour, baking soda, spices and salt in a bowl and add to wet ingredients, mixing until just combined.
Gently stir through chocolate chips and berries. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes.
Roll into golf ball sized portions and place on prepared sheets leaving at least 1 inch between each cookie. No need to flatten, the dough will spread.
Bake for 12-15 minutes or until cooked in the center and edges are golden. Cool for 5 minutes before serving.

name: No Yeast Cinnamon Rolls
ingredients: 2 1⁄2 cups (340g) wholewheat spelt flour (or gluten free)
1⁄2 cup (125ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
2 tbs (40ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup) divided
1⁄4 cup (65ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Preheat oven to 320°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
In a large bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, baking soda and cinnamon until combined.
Add milk, coconut oil, egg, maple syrup and vinegar and mix until dough comes together and is smooth.
For the filling, combine all ingredients to form a wet paste.
Roll dough out onto a lightly floured bench into a rough 10 x 15 inch rectangle shape.
Spread filling evenly over the dough, covering it entirely. Roll up along the long edge so you have one long log. Using a serrated knife cut into 14 even rolls.
Arrange on baking sheet, cut-side-up and barely touching, allowing just a little room for them to expand.
Bake rolls for 20 minutes. Remove from oven and brush with remaining maple syrup and return to oven for a further 5 minutes to glaze. Set aside to cool.
Store in an airtight container for up to 4 days or frozen for up to 3 months.

name: Yogurt & Banana Pudding
ingredients: 2 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
preparation: Place yogurt, banana, chia and cacao in a small food processor and blend until combined. Transfer to a bowl and set aside to thicken for 5 minutes.
Top with almonds and a drizzle of honey to serve.

name: Choc Banana Bread
ingredients: 1⁄4 cup (60ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
1 1⁄2 cups (205g) wholewheat spelt flour (or gluten free)
80g 70% dark chocolate (or dairy-free alternative) roughly chopped
preparation: Preheat the oven to 320°F. Line a 8 x 4 inch loaf tin with baking paper.
In a large bowl, mix together maple syrup, coconut oil, vinegar, bananas, eggs and vanilla until combined.
Add flour, coconut, baking soda, cinnamon and salt. Mix until just combined and fold in chocolate.
Pour batter into the prepared loaf tin and bake for 45 minutes, or until golden and centre is just cooked. Remove from oven and cool for at least 30 minutes before cutting into 14 even slices.
Store in an airtight container for up to 5 days or freeze for up to 3 months.

name: Energy Rice Cakes
ingredients: 1⁄2 tsp sesame seeds (or black sesame seeds)
1⁄2 small red chilli pepper finely sliced
1 sprig of fresh cilantro leaves roughly chopped
preparation: Top one rice cake with tzatziki, cucumber and sesame seeds.
Top the other with hummus, chilli pepper and cilantro.
Season both with salt and pepper. Enjoy!

name: Protein Snack Tray
preparation: Place eggs in a saucepan of cold water and bring to the boil. Continue to simmer for 5  minutes. Remove with a slotted spoon and place in a sink of cold water to cool. Peel and cut in half.
Place cheese in a small bowl and arrange on a platter with eggs, smoked salmon, lettuce, almonds and crackers. Season with salt and pepper and serve.

name: Chai Tea
ingredients: 2 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
1 cup (250ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
preparation: Combine ground spices and tea in a jar, mixing well. (This can be stored in the pantry for up to 3 months.)

To make tea, blend 2 tsp chai spice mix with a little of the boiling water in a small saucepan. Add remaining water and honey and bring almost to the boil. Remove from heat and let stand for a few minutes for flavours to infuse.
Add milk to saucepan and bring to a simmer. Remove from heat immediately and allow to sit for a few minutes before pouring into cups and dusting with a little extra cinnamon to serve.

To make fresh tea with roasted whole spices, toast 1 tsp fennel seeds, 10 cardamom pods (or 1⁄2 tsp cardamom seeds), 1 tsp black peppercorns, 4 star anise and 2 cinnamon quills (broken into pieces) in a small skillet over medium-low heat for a few minutes. Process spices with 2 tbs grated ginger and 2 tbs black tea until combined. Store refrigerated or frozen in a glass jar. 
To serve, combine 1 tbs wet chai with hot water and honey and continue as above.  (You may want to use a strainer to serve.)

name: Easy No-Knead Bread
ingredients: 2 tsp dried yeast (see note below to use your own starter)
preparation: In a large bowl place flour, yeast and salt and mix together with a wooden spoon until combined.
Slowly add the water while mixing until combined. The mixture will be quite sticky.  Don't be tempted to add more flour as this is the consistency you want for best results.
Cover the bowl with a plate or clean teatowel and leave in a warm place for 2-3 hours to prove until it doubles in size.
Place a 10 inch Dutch oven with lid in the oven and preheat to 445°F, for 30 minutes.

Tear off a large sheet of baking paper and put aside. Dust a clean bench with flour and turn dough out onto bench. Use hands or a dough-scraper to pull edges of the dough inwards to roughly shape into a large ball.
Use a scraper or spatula to flip dough upside down and onto the sheet of baking paper.

Using thick oven mitts, carefully remove the Dutch oven from the oven (it will be hot!). Fold up the corners of the baking paper and transfer dough to the hot pot. Cover with lid and bake for 30 minutes.
Remove lid and continue to bake for 13-15 minutes or until the top is a deep golden brown with crusty edges.
Remove from oven and transfer bread to a cooling rack.  Rest for at least 15 minutes before slicing.
Using Sourdough Starter
Use 7 oz of your starter with 14 oz (3 cups) flour, 2 tsp salt and 9 1⁄2 fl oz (1 1⁄8 cups) water and follow the same method.

name: DIY Sourdough Starter
ingredients: 50ml water lukewarm (or room temperature, not hot)
100ml water lukewarm (or room temperature, not hot)
preparation: Day 1:  Mix the base mixture of flour and water in a jar to a thick paste. Cover with a damp clean cloth/tea towel and set aside at room temperature, away from any heat.

Day 2: The next day you need to feed your starter. It will have expanded and have visible bubbles as the wild yeast fermentation process has begun. 
To your jar of starter add the daily feed of flour and warm, not hot, water. Mix well, cover and set aside. (It’s a good idea to put a rubber band around your jar at the level of the mixture so you can gauge how much it’s growing. If it’s not expanding, something is wrong. It’s either dying because it’s too hot or it needs to be fed.)

Day 3-5: Each day, take 3 1⁄2 oz of starter mixture and combine with the daily feed of flour and warm, not hot, water. Mix well, cover and set aside. 
You can set aside the remaining starter for other use - see tips below.

Day 6: Take 3 1⁄2 oz of starter mixture and combine with the daily feed of flour and warm, not hot, water. Mix well, cover and set aside. 
By now your starter should be doubling in size and have many bubbles below the surface. If not continue for a few more days. If after a week nothing is happening, throw it out and start again.
Feed your starter one more time the night before you plan to use so it will be bubbly and raring to go. Remember more bubbles means lighter bread.
Baking Day: Take 3 1⁄2 - 8 1⁄2 oz of starter, depending on your recipe to make your bread.

Remember to keep the remaining starter for your next loaf. Starter can be kept covered in the fridge for a few days or even weeks until needed again. Just give it at least 2 feeds, as above,  before using to refresh. If keeping for a number of weeks then a weekly feed will help keep your starter active.

name: Chocolate Hazelnut Cookies
ingredients: 1 can of chickpeas (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
1⁄3 cup (90g) honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
1⁄4 cup (75g) crunchy natural peanut butter (or other nut butter)
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Place chickpeas between 2 sheets of paper towel and rub chickpeas to remove any excess liquid.

Place all ingredients, except chocolate in a food processor. Pulse on high for 1 minute, until all ingredients are blended together to form a dough. Place dough in refrigerator for 10 minutes to firm up before rolling.

Divide mixture into 16 balls and place on baking tray. Flatten balls out with the back of a spoon and bake for 10-12 minutes or until golden. Allow to cool for a few minutes then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
Melt chocolate in a glass bowl in the microwave on high for 30 seconds at a time until smooth and melted. Drizzle over cookies and allow to set.
Serve 1 cookie as a snack. Keep in an airtight container for up to 5 days.

name: Power Protein Yogurt with Peanut Butter
ingredients: 1⁄4 cup (30g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
2 tbs crunchy natural peanut butter (or other nut butter)
preparation: Combine yogurt and protein powder in a bowl, adding sufficient water to blend.
Mix peanut butter with boiling water to make a thick sauce.
Divide yogurt between serving bowls, top with seeds, peanut butter sauce and berries to serve.

name: Easter Egg Bliss Balls
ingredients: 1 1⁄3 cups (160g) cashews soaked in water overnight & drained
1 tbs (20ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Combine all ingredients except chocolate in a food processor and blend until fine and mixture holds together. Transfer to a bowl, cover and refrigerate for 30 minutes.

Place chocolate pieces in a non-plastic bowl. Microwave for 1 minute, then 30-second intervals, stirring in between, until fully melted. Or place bowl over a saucepan with a small amount of simmering water and stir until melted.

Take about a tablespoon of the mixture and form into 10 egg-shaped balls. Transfer eggs to a wire rack set over a tray, separating them so they’re not touching and drizzle with melted chocolate. Transfer to the refrigerator for 30 minutes to set.
Store refrigerated in an airtight container for up to 5 days.

name: Moroccan-Spiced Turkey Meatballs
ingredients: 1 tsp Moroccan spice mix (or Ras el hanout-a mixture of cumin, coriander, paprika, ginger, turmeric)
1⁄4 bunch of fresh cilantro (3 oz bunch) roughly chopped
preparation: Preheat oven to 390°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Combine mince, breadcrumbs, currants, spice, garlic, zest, cilantro and salt in a large bowl. Roll into 12 even balls and transfer to baking sheet.
Spray with oil and bake for 12-15 minutes or until golden and cooked through.
Squeeze over lemon and serve with yogurt.

name: Broccomole with Pita Chips
ingredients: 1 medium (2 1/2 oz) wholewheat pita pocket (or gluten free) cut into triangles
100g cherry tomatoes half diced & half cut in half to serve
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F .
Cook broccoli in a saucepan of boiling salted water for 3-4 minutes until just tender.
Place pita bread onto a baking sheet and bake for 4-5 minutes until golden. Set aside to cool.
Place drained broccoli in a food processor and blend until smooth. Transfer to a plate and spread out to cool.
Combine avocado, onion, cilantro, diced tomato, lime juice and cooled broccoli in a bowl and adjust seasoning.
Serve broccomole with pita chips, cucumbers and extra halved tomatoes.

name: Sweet Potato & Salmon Frittatas
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F. Line 10 holes of a 12-hole muffin tin with paper liners and set aside.
Heat oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add sweet potato and onion and saute for 3 minutes until softened.
Add spinach and cook for another minute or until wilted. Set aside to cool slightly.
Whisk eggs, ricotta, chives, salt and pepper together in a large bowl.
Add spinach mixture and stir until well combined.
Fold through salmon and divide between the 10 muffin holes.
Bake frittatas for 20 minutes or until completely set.  Remove from tin and allow individual frittatas to cool on a cooling rack.
Store refrigerated in an airtight container.

name: Lemon & Pistachio Bliss Balls
ingredients: 3 tbs (30g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
1 tbs (30g) honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
preparation: Combine all ingredients except pistachios in a medium bowl and mix well to combine. The mixture should form a nice dough that holds together when squeezed.
Form mixture into 8 even balls and roll in pistachio crumbs.
Store refrigerated in an airtight container.

name: Rosemary & Parmesan Crackers
ingredients: 1 cup (135g) all-purpose flour (or gluten-free if required)
1 sprig of rosemary 1 tsp finely chopped leaves
preparation: Preheat oven to 320°F. Line a baking sheet with baking paper and set aside.
Combine all dry ingredients together in the base of a food processor and pulse to combine. Add oil and half the water and pulse until combined.
Form mixture into a ball and roll between baking paper to 1 1⁄4 inch thick and chill for 10 minutes.
Cut into 1 1⁄2 inch squares and place on prepared baking sheet. Bake for 15-20 minutes until crisp.
Cool on tray and store in an airtight container.

name: Smoky & Spicy Trail Mix
ingredients: 2 tbs (60g) honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
2 tbs (40g) crunchy natural peanut butter (or other nut butter)
preparation: Preheat oven to 300°F. Line a rimmed baking sheet with baking paper and set aside.
Whisk honey, peanut butter and melted coconut oil together until blended. (Heat if necessary)
Combine remaining ingredients together in a large bowl and toss well to combine.
Add combined wet ingredients to dry and mix well.
Scatter mixture over prepared sheet and bake for 20-25 minutes, turning halfway through, until golden brown.
Place tray on a wire rack to cool.  Once completely cool, store in an airtight container at room temperature.

name: Chocolate Raspberry Truffles
ingredients: 100g cashews soaked in water overnight then drained
1⁄4 cup (75g) honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
60g 70% dark chocolate (or dairy-free alternative) broken into pieces
1 tbs freeze-dried raspberries or strawberries optional
preparation: Blend cashews, raspberries, coconut, cocoa, honey and coconut oil in a food processor until smooth and combined.
Roll mixture into 12 even-sized balls and transfer to a tray lined with baking paper.

Place chocolate pieces in a non-plastic bowl. Microwave for 1 minute, then 30-second intervals, stirring in between, until fully melted. Or place bowl over a saucepan with a small amount of simmering water and stir until melted.
Spoon a teaspoon of melted chocolate over each truffle and sprinkle with freeze-dried raspberries if using. Refrigerate for 30 minutes to set.
Store truffles refrigerated in an airtight container for up to 5 days or freeze for up to 2 months..

name: High Protein Spicy Tuna Bites
ingredients: 1⁄2 cup (125g) Greek yogurt (or dairy-free alternative) plus extra to serve
6 sprigs of dill plus extra to serve, finely chopped
2 small green chilli peppers finely chopped
preparation: Preheat oven to 390°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Heat oil in a small non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cook for 5 minutes until soft.
Combine cooked onion, tuna and almond meal in a large bowl.
Add remaining ingredients, season with salt and pepper and mix well.

Form mixture into 20 even-sized balls and arrange on baking sheet. Bake for 15 minutes or until golden. Serve 2 per snack with extra yogurt and dill.

Store refrigerated in an airtight container for up to 5 days or frozen for up to 3 months.

name: Quick PB&J Power Balls
ingredients: 1 cup (100g) oat flour (or gluten free flour)
1⁄3 cup (100g) crunchy natural peanut butter (or other nut butter)
1⁄4 cup (75g) honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
preparation: Place all ingredients in a medium sized bowl and mix well to combine. The mixture should form a nice dough that holds when squeezed.
Roll mixture into 12  even sized balls (approx 3⁄4 oz).
Store refrigerated in an airtight container.

name: Lamington Slice
ingredients: 1⁄2 cup (150g) honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
1⁄3 cup (40g) all-purpose flour (or gluten-free if required)
1 tbs (30g) honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
1⁄4 cup (75g) honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
preparation: Preheat oven to  355°F. Line the base and sides of an 8 inch square baking tin with baking paper.
Place dates in a heatproof bowl and cover with boiling water. Stand for 10 minutes to soften, then drain.
Process dates, honey and vanilla in a food processor until smooth.
Add almond meal, coconut, flour and baking powder and blend until combined.
Press mixture into the base of prepared tin and bake for 15 minutes until golden. Cool in freezer.

Meanwhile, to make jam cook raspberries and honey in a small saucepan for 5-7 minutes or until raspberries have broken down. Stir through chia seeds and pour mixture evenly over the chilled base. Return to freezer to set.
To make topping, combine oil, honey and salt in a bowl and whisk in cocoa powder until smooth. Pour evenly over jam layer and sprinkle with coconut. Refrigerate for 1-2 hours until completely set.
Bring slice to room temperature to avoid splitting the topping, then cut into 16 even pieces.
Store refrigerated in an airtight container for up to 1 week.

name: Power Plus Bars
ingredients: 1 cup (100g) natural untoasted muesli (or gluten free)
1⁄2 cup (150g) crunchy natural peanut butter (or other nut butter)
1⁄2 cup (150g) honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F and line an 8 inch square baking tin with baking paper.
Combine muesli, protein powder and spice together in a large bowl.
Warm apple sauce, peanut butter and honey in a small saucepan for a few minutes to combine.
Add wet ingredients to dry and mix well.
Press mixture firmly into prepared tin. Scatter over sunflower kernels and gently press into the surface.
Bake for 15 minutes, until golden.  Set aside in tin to cool before cutting into 8 bars.

name: Choc Drizzle Protein Bars
ingredients: 1 cup (120g) vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
1 cup (100g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
1⁄3 cup (120g) honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup) warmed
preparation: Line an 8 inch loaf tin with baking paper.
Combine protein powder, oats, almonds, flaxseeds and dates in a bowl, mixing well.
In a separate bowl, combine honey and coconut oil and mix into dry ingredients.
Press mixture very firmly into prepared tin, smoothing the top with the back of a spoon.

Place chocolate in a non-plastic bowl and melt in the microwave for 1 minute, then 30-second intervals, stirring in between, until fully melted. Transfer to a small piping bag or ziplock bag (cutting the corner off) and drizzle over loaf. Alternatively, pour chocolate in one even layer over top and smooth out with a spoon.
Refrigerate for 2 hours to set and cut into 16 even pieces.

name: Apple Pie & Cream
ingredients: 1 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
preparation: Preheat oven to 320°F and line a small sheet with baking paper.
Combine almond meal, coconut and butter in a small bowl. Spread on baking sheet and bake for 10 minutes, stirring halfway through, until golden. Set aside to cool.
Meanwhile, place apples, water and cinnamon in a small saucepan over medium heat. Cover and cook for 5-8 minutes until apples have softened. Remove from heat and stir through honey.
Divide apples between bowls and top with yogurt and almond meal crumb to serve.

name: Cacao Peppermint Latte
ingredients: 3⁄4 cup (190ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
1 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
5g dark chocolate finely chopped or grated
preparation: Place milk and cacao in a small saucepan and warm over low-medium heat. Don’t let it boil!
Remove from the heat and whisk in coffee, maple syrup and peppermint.
Pour into a mug, top with chocolate and serve.

name: Eggnog
ingredients: 1 tbs (20ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
3 1⁄4 cups (800ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
1⁄4 tsp ground nutmeg plus extra to serve
preparation: Whisk egg yolks, maple syrup and milk in a medium saucepan over medium-low heat. Continue to whisk until the mixture thickens slightly and just begins to coat the back of a spoon.
Remove from heat and mix in vanilla and spices. Set aside to cool then refrigerate for 1-2 hours to chill.
Whisk well before pouring into small glasses and top with extra nutmeg to serve.

name: Blueberry Lemon Spritzer
ingredients: 1⁄2 bunch of fresh mint (3 oz bunch) reserve a few sprigs & pick remaining leaves
preparation: Muddle blueberries, lemon juice and picked mint leaves in a jug or jar.
Divide between tall glasses, add ice and sparkling water and top with lemon slices and mint sprigs to serve.

name: Gingerbread Loaf with Spiced Almond Drizzle
ingredients: 1⁄3 cup (80ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
1⁄3 cup (80ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
1 tbs almond butter (or other nut butter)
1 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F and line an 8 1⁄2 x 4 inch loaf tin with baking paper.
In a large mixing bowl combine flour, almond meal, spices, baking powder and salt and mix well.
In a separate bowl whisk eggs, milk, maple syrup, oil and vanilla together. Add to dry ingredients and mix thoroughly.
Transfer batter to loaf tin and bake for 35 minutes or until golden and cooked through. Allow to cool in tin for 5 minutes before removing and transferring to a wire rack to cool.
Combine drizzle ingredients in a small bowl, drizzle over cake, slice and serve.

name: Pineapple, Passionfruit & Mint Crush
ingredients: 2 cups crushed ice, plus extra to serve
preparation: Blend pineapple, passionfruit juice, lime juice and ice in a food processor until smooth.
Divide extra ice and juice between glasses and top with pineapple wedges and mint to serve.

name: Raspberry & Lime Fizz
ingredients: 1 tbs (30g) honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
preparation: Combine lime juice and honey in a small jug and mix well to combine. Add raspberries and muddle lightly.
Divide between glasses, add ice and sparkling water and top with lime slices and thyme to serve.

name: Pumpkin Spice Latte
ingredients: 1⁄4 cup (60g) canned pumpkin puree (unsweetened) or 1 3/4 oz pumpkin, steamed & mashed
1 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
1⁄4 tsp pumpkin pie spice plus extra to dust
preparation: Place milk and pumpkin puree in a small saucepan over medium heat. Heat until just hot, but don’t let it come to a boil.
Remove saucepan from heat and whisk in remaining ingredients.
Pour into a mug and dust with extra spice to serve.

name: Maple & Pumpkin Pie
ingredients: 1 sheet of reduced-fat shortcrust pastry (or gluten free if required)
1⁄4 cup (60ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
1 tsp ground cinnamon plus extra to serve
2⁄3 cup (160g) Greek yogurt (or dairy-free alternative) to serve
preparation: Preheat oven to 390°F and spray an 8 inch pie dish (or tart tin) with oil.

Press pastry sheet into pie dish to line, trimming any over hanging edges. Cover with baking paper and fill with pie weights or dried beans or rice. Bake for 10 minutes. Remove paper and weights and reduce oven temperature to 375°F.

Whisk together pumpkin puree, milk, maple syrup, eggs, vanilla, cinnamon, nutmeg, ginger and salt in a bowl until combined. Pour into pastry case and bake for 40-45 minutes or until set. The centre should still be a little wobbly and the edges firm.
Cool on a wire rack before cutting into 8 slices. Dust with a little extra cinnamon and serve with yoghurt.
Store remaining pie covered in the refrigerator for 5 days.
**For 14 oz tin pumpkin puree equivalent, microwave 10 oz grated squash with a pinch of salt, covered for 3 minutes on high or steam diced squash for 5-10 minutes until tender and mash.

name: Pumpkin Macaroons
ingredients: 300g butternut squash peeled & diced or 10 1/2 oz pumpkin puree (unsweetened)
1⁄2 cup (125ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Preheat oven to 320°F and line a large baking sheet with baking paper.

Place squash in a microwave-safe bowl, cover and cook on HIGH for 3 minutes until squash is tender. (Alternatively, place in a steamer over a saucepan of boiling water and simmer, covered, for 5-10 minutes until tender) Mash and spread on a plate to cool slightly.
Combine coconut, flour, baking powder and cinnamon in a bowl and set aside.
Whisk squash (or pumpkin puree if using), maple syrup and vanilla together. Add egg and continue to whisk until smooth. Stir through flour mixture until combined.

Using an icecream scoop or tablespoon make 14 rounded cookies and place on baking sheet. Flatten slightly and make an indent in the top of each cookie with your finger. Insert a pepita into each cookie to form the pumpkin’s stem.
Bake for 15-20 minutes or until the edges are golden. Cool on baking sheets for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.
Store cooled cookies in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 3 days or freeze for 2 months.

name: Caramel Popcorn
ingredients: 1⁄4 cup (75g) crunchy natural peanut butter (or other nut butter)
1⁄4 cup (65ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Preheat oven to 250°F. Line a baking sheet with baking paper.

Place popcorn kernels in a non-stick saucepan and cover with a lid. Place over medium heat and cook for about 4 minutes until there is a 2 second gap between pops. Transfer to a large bowl and set aside.

Heat peanut butter and maple syrup in a small saucepan over medium heat until just beginning to boil. Stir through coconut milk and continue to simmer for 5 minutes until golden and thickened. Pour caramel over popcorn and toss well to coat.
Distribute mixture evenly over prepared sheet and bake for 30 minutes, tossing after 15 minutes. Serve once cooled.
Store in an airtight container once completely cool.

name: Roasted Beet Dip with Dukkah
ingredients: 1 large (3 1/2 oz) wholewheat pita bread or pocket (or gluten free) roughly torn
3 tsp dukkah (a mix of chopped almonds, sesame seeds & ground cumin)
selection of raw vegetable crudités to serve eg. mini cucumbers, cherry tomatoes, radishes, celery
preparation: Preheat oven to 390°F.
Wrap each beet tightly in foil and place on a baking sheet. Transfer to the oven and roast for 40 minutes or until cooked through and tender.
In the last 10 minutes of cooking, add pita bread to the same sheet and bake for 5 - 10 minutes until golden and crisp.
Rub beet skins off with paper towel and cut in quarters.
Blend cooked beets, lemon juice, salt and garlic until combined. Scrape down the sides, add yogurt and blend until smooth. Adjust seasoning.
Transfer dip to a bowl, scatter over dukkah and serve with pita crisps and vegetable crudites.

name: Carrot Cake Bliss Balls
ingredients: 1 tbs maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Place dates, carrots, almond meal, maple syrup and spices in a food processor and blend until fine and the mixture comes together.
Using wet hands, roll mixture into 12 even-sized balls and roll in coconut.
Store refrigerated in an airtight container for up to 5 days or frozen for 3 months.

name: Ghostly Bliss Balls
ingredients: 1 tbs (20ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
20g 70% dark chocolate (or dairy-free alternative) roughly chopped
preparation: Place dates, carrots, almond meal, maple syrup and spices in a food processor and blend until fine and the mixture comes together.
Using wet hands, roll mixture into 12 even-sized balls, roll in coconut and insert lollipop sticks.
Cut 6 inch square pieces of muslin, place balls in the center and secure with twine.

Heat chocolate in a non-plastic bowl in the microwave in 30-second intervals, stirring in between, until fully melted. Using a skewer or toothpick place a small amount of chocolate on the back of the eyeball to attach.
Store refrigerated in an airtight container for up to 5 days or freeze for up to 3 months.

name: Super Charged Granola
ingredients: 1⁄2 cup (125ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Preheat oven to 300°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Combine maple syrup and oil in a small bowl.
Toss almonds, buckwheat, pepitas, sunflower kernels, sesame seeds, chia, macadamia and salt in a large bowl to combine.
Pour over combined maple syrup and oil and mix well to thoroughly coat all the ingredients.
Spread mixture over baking sheet and bake for 35-40 minutes.
Stir through remaining ingredients whilst still warm and set aside to cool.
Once completely cooled, store in an airtight container for up to a month or freeze for up to 3 months.

name: Super Hydrating Juice
ingredients: 2 sprigs of fresh mint leaves picked
preparation: Blend all ingredients in a food processor or blender until very smooth.

name: Ultimate Plant-Based Snack Board
preparation: Arrange all ingredients on a platter to serve.

name: Japanese Glazed Chicken Meatballs
ingredients: 1⁄2 cup (50g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
2 tsp soy sauce (or tamari if gluten free)
2 tsp soy sauce (or tamari if gluten free)
preparation: Combine chicken, oats, scallion and ginger in a large bowl. Add soy sauce and cornstarch and mix until well combined. Use damp hands to portion and roll mixture into 12 balls.
Place a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add meatballs in batches and cook for 5 minutes until well browned all over and cooked through.
Wipe skillet clean and return to heat. Add sauce ingredients, return meatballs to pan and toss to coat in the sauce.
Serve hot or cold, as a post-workout snack. Store refrigerated in an airtight container.

name: Wasabi Hummus
ingredients: 1 can of chickpeas (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
1⁄2 bunch of baby carrots (7 oz trimmed bunch) trimmed & cut in half
preparation: Blend chickpeas, tahini, wasabi, salt, lemon juice, zest and garlic in a food processor for 5 minutes or until very smooth, pausing halfway to scrape down the sides of the bowl. Add water whilst motor is running.
Adjust seasoning and transfer to a bowl. Scatter over crushed wasabi peas and serve with vegetables.
Store refrigerated in an airtight container.

name: Ginger & Wasabi Trail Mix
ingredients: 1 nori sheet cut in 1 inch pieces with scissors
preparation: Preheat oven to 325°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Place almonds, pepitas and sunflower kernels on baking sheet and spray with oil. Add ginger and toss well to coat. Toast for 10 minutes.
Toss nori, peas and toasted ginger mix together and once cool store in an airtight container.

name: Zucchini & Chive Bread
ingredients: 1⁄2 cup (125ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
2 1⁄2 cups (250g) oat flour (or gluten free flour)
preparation: Whisk milk and lemon juice together in a separate bowl to create buttermilk and set aside for 5 minutes.
Preheat oven to 325°F and grease and line an  8 1⁄2 x 4 inch loaf tin and set aside.
Combine flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt in a medium-sized bowl and mix to combine.
Once buttermilk has formed add eggs and whisk until fully combined.
Fold buttermilk mixture through flour mixture, add cheese, chives and zucchini and mix until just combined.
Pour batter into prepared tin and bake for 1 hour or until an inserted skewer comes out clean.
Remove loaf from tin and allow to cool on a wire rack before slicing.
Store refrigerated in an airtight container.

name: Roasted Apple Crumbles
ingredients: 2 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
2 tbs rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
preparation: Preheat oven to 325°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Place apples on sheet, cut-side-up and drizzle with maple syrup.
Combine oil, oats, coconut and almonds in a small bowl and sprinkle over apples.
Bake for 25 minutes or until crumble is golden and apples are tender. Serve warm with coconut on the side.

name: Rhubarb & Coconut Fool
ingredients: 1 tbs (20ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
2 tbs (20g) toasted granola (or gluten free) to serve
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Toss rhubarb, orange juice and cardamom together and arrange over sheet. Cover with foil and bake for 12-15 minutes until tender.
Transfer rhubarb and juices to a bowl, add maple syrup and mash. Refrigerate for 15 minutes until cool.
Spoon half the rhubarb into the base of serving glasses, followed by half the yogurt. Repeat layer then use a skewer to swirl the layers together. Scatter with granola and serve.

name: Vegan Matcha Latte
ingredients: 1 tbs (20ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Whisk matcha and hot water in a small saucepan until smooth.
Add remaining ingredients and heat for 2 minutes, whisking constantly to foam, until warm.
Pour into cups and serve immediately.

name: Strawberry & Coconut Muffins
ingredients: 1⁄3 cup (100g) brown rice syrup (honey or maple syrup)
1⁄3 cup (80ml) coconut milk, canned at room temperature
1 cup (135g) all-purpose flour (or gluten-free if required)
preparation: Preheat oven to 320°F and lightly grease a 12-hole muffin tin.
Add oil, rice syrup, coconut milk, vanilla and chia seeds to a large bowl and whisk until smooth. Set aside to stand for 5 minutes to thicken.
Combine flour, almond meal and baking powder and gently mix though wet mixture until just combined. Fold through most of the strawberries, reserving some for the top.
Divide mixture evenly between muffin holes and top with remaining strawberries and coconut flakes. Bake for 18-20 minutes. Cool and serve.
Store in an airtight container for up to 3 days or frozen for up to 1 month.

name: Lemon Coconut Self-Saucing Puddings
ingredients: 2 tbs (40g) coconut oil melted, plus extra for greasing ramekins
1⁄3 cup (80ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
1⁄2 cup (70g) all-purpose flour (or gluten-free if required) sifted
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F and grease ramekins (1⁄2 cup volume) with extra oil.
Using electric beaters, mix melted oil, maple syrup, egg yolks and half the lemon zest until creamy. Fold in flour, coconut, milk and lemon juice.
Place egg whites in a clean dry bowl, beat with clean beaters until firm peaks form. Gently fold into pudding mixture. Divide mixture between ramekins.
Place the ramekins into a deep baking dish and pour in enough boiling water to come a third of the way up the side of the dishes. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until the puddings have risen.
Serve immediately with yogurt and a sprinkling of the remaining zest.

name: Dark Chocolate Salted Cupcakes
ingredients: 1 1⁄2 cups (200g) wholewheat spelt flour (or gluten free)
1⁄3 cup (80ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
100g 70% dark chocolate (or dairy-free alternative) roughly chopped
preparation: Preheat oven to 320°F and line a 12-hole muffin tin with muffin cases.
Place flour, cocoa, baking powder and coffee in a large bowl and stir to combine.
In another bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, maple syrup and oil until combined and stir into dry ingredients.

Add chocolate and stir until just combined. Spoon mixture evenly into muffin tin and scatter over salt flakes. Bake for 20-25 minutes until cooked in the centre. Cool in the tin for 5 minutes before serving.
Store muffins in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 3 days or freeze individually for up to 2 months.

name: Dark Choc Chilli Fudge
ingredients: 1⁄4 cup (65ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
1⁄4 cup (20g) raw cacao powder (or cocoa powder)
preparation: Grease and line a 8 x 4 inch loaf tin with baking paper.
Heat almond butter, coconut oil, maple syrup, cacao and ground chilli in a saucepan over a low–medium heat, stirring until combined. Gently simmer for 5 minutes or until smooth.
Pour into the prepared tin, sprinkle with chilli and salt flakes and freeze for 2 hours or until firm.
Fill a large heat-proof jug with boiling water. Dip a large sharp knife into the water, holding for 5 seconds, then remove and dry with a kitchen towel. Use hot knife to cut fudge into even squares.
Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

name: Chocolate Zucchini Muffins
ingredients: 1⁄4 cup (65ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
1 1⁄3 cups (180g) wholewheat spelt flour (or gluten free)
1⁄3 cup (80g) coconut oil melted, plus extra for greasing
preparation: Preheat oven to 320°F and grease 10 holes of a 12-hole muffin tin with coconut oil.
Whisk together milk, maple syrup, vanilla and eggs in a large bowl. Add flour, cocoa, baking powder, salt and oil and whisk again until combined.
Squeeze as much liquid out of the zucchini as you can then fold through muffin mixture until just combined. Spoon mixture evenly into muffin tin and bake for 20 minutes or until cooked.
Store remaining muffins in an airtight container for up to 3 days or frozen individually for up to 3 months.

name: Sticky Date Puddings
ingredients: 1 tbs olive oil melted, plus extra for greasing
1⁄2 cup (70g) wholewheat spelt flour (or gluten free)
1 tbs maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Preheat oven to 320°F and grease small ramekins with coconut oil.
Place dates, boiling water and baking soda in a small bowl and mix to combine. Stand for 5 minutes to soften.
Transfer dates and water to a small food processor. Add oil, vanilla, flour, baking powder and egg and blend until smooth and combined.
Spoon mixture into ramekins and bake for 20 minutes or until cooked.
Cool slightly for 5 minutes. Top with yogurt and drizzle over maple syrup to serve.

name: Pumpkin Bread of Dreams
ingredients: 1 tbs (30g) honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
1⁄3 cup (45g) sunflower seeds (kernels) plus extra to garnish
preparation: Preheat the oven to 355°F. Grease a 10 inch loaf tin and line with baking paper.
Combine squash, eggs, oil, honey and lemon juice in a large bowl.
Whisk almond meal, coconut flour, baking soda, nutmeg, cinnamon and salt together and stir through squash mixture. (if mix feels too wet, add a little more coconut flour)
Gently fold in pecans and seeds until combined.
Pour into prepared tin, sprinkle over extra sunflower kernels and bake for 1–1 1⁄2 hours or until an inserted skewer comes out clean.
Stand for 5 minutes before turning out of the tin and cool before slicing.

name: Chocolate Peanut Butter Bark
ingredients: 1⁄4 cup (60g) crunchy natural peanut butter (or other nut butter)
preparation: Line a baking tray with baking paper.
Place chocolate in a heat-proof bowl and microwave for 30 seconds at a time until melted and smooth, or alternatively place bowl over a saucepan of simmering water.
Pour chocolate onto baking paper and using a spatula spread out into a slab, about 1⁄3 inch thick.
Heat peanut butter in a microwave on high for 30 seconds, or until softened and smooth.
Drop spoonfuls of peanut butter around chocolate and swirl through with a knife. Scatter over peanuts, cacao nibs and salt.
Refrigerate for 20 minutes or until set. Break into pieces to serve.
Store in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 2 weeks.

name: Gooey Chocolate & Almond Brownies
ingredients: 1⁄3 cup (80g) almond butter (or other nut butter)
1⁄3 cup (40g) raw cacao powder (or cocoa powder)
1⁄3 cup (80ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Preheat oven to 320°F and line an 8 inch square baking tin with baking paper.
Place butter, almond butter, cacao, almond meal, eggs, maple syrup and salt in a large bowl and mix well to combine. Fold through chocolate and almonds.
Spoon into prepared tin, smooth the top and bake for 12-15 minutes until cooked but still gooey in the middle.
Cool completely and cut into even squares.
Store refrigerated in an airtight container for up to 5 days or frozen for up to 3 months.

name: Rice Cakes 3 Ways
ingredients: 2 tsp crunchy natural peanut butter (or other nut butter)
1⁄2 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
preparation: Top three rice cakes each with:
peanut butter, banana slices and a drizzle of honey
cottage cheese and a sprinkle of pepitas
ricotta and sliced strawberries
Enjoy after your workout.

name: Mini Christmas Chocolate Puddings
ingredients: 1⁄4 cup (65ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Preheat oven to 320°F and line a 12-hole muffin tin with paper cases.
Place dates in a medium bowl and cover with boiling water. Allow to stand for 10 minutes to soften. Reserve 1⁄2 cup of date water then drain.
Process dates, reserved water, orange juice, zest, maple syrup, oil, vanilla, eggs, cocoa and spices in a food processor until smooth.
Add almond meal and baking powder and pulse to combine. Transfer to a large bowl and fold through raisins until combined.
Spoon into muffin cases and smooth the top. Arrange flaked almonds evenly around each pudding and place a cranberry in the centre.
Bake for 30 minutes or until cooked in the centre. Store in an airtight container for 3 days or freeze for 1 month.

name: Cheesy Zucchini Muffins
ingredients: 1⁄2 bunch of fresh basil (5 oz bunch) leaves picked & chopped
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F and line a 12-hole muffin tin, with muffin papers. (Alternatively grease)
Place flour, baking powder and salt in a large bowl and whisk to combine.
Squeeze zucchini between your hands to remove as much liquid as possible, add to flour mixture and toss to coat.
Add eggs, scallions and basil and stir to combine. Fold through cottage cheese and tasty cheese until just combined.
Spoon mixture into muffin tin and bake for 30 minutes until golden and cooked in the centre.
Store muffins refrigerated in an airtight container for up to 3 days or frozen for up to 3 months.

name: Almond, Date & Banana Snack Smoothie
ingredients: 1 pitted medjool date pre-soaked in boiling water
2 tbs vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
preparation: Combine all ingredients, including date soaking water, in a blender and blend until smooth. Divide between glasses to serve.

name: Banana & Peanut Butter Snack Smoothie
ingredients: 1 1⁄2 tbs vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
1 tbs rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
2 tsp crunchy natural peanut butter (or other nut butter)
1 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
preparation: Blend all ingredients until smooth. Enjoy!

name: Chocolate Espresso Snack Smoothie
ingredients: 1⁄2 cup (125ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
1 tsp instant coffee adjust depending on taste
1 tbs vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
1 tbs rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
1 tsp raw cacao powder (or cocoa powder)
preparation: Dissolve coffee in the boiling water.
Blend all ingredients until smooth. Divide between glasses and enjoy!

name: Mango & Turmeric Snack Smoothie
ingredients: 1⁄4 cup (65ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
1 1⁄2 tbs vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
preparation: Place all ingredients in a blender and blend on high until smooth and creamy. Transfer to a glass to serve.

name: Creamy Green Snack Smoothie
ingredients: 1⁄2 cup (125ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
1 tbs vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
preparation: Blend all ingredients on high until smooth and creamy, divide between glasses and serve.

name: Raspberry Coconut Snack Smoothie
ingredients: 2 tbs vanilla protein powder (or natural protein powder)
preparation: Place all ingredients in a blender and blend on high until smooth and creamy. Transfer to a glass to serve.

name: Christmas Florentines
preparation: Scatter almonds and seeds over an oven-proof baking sheet and grill for 4-6 minutes, tossing after a few minutes until golden. Stir through goji berries.

At the same time, place a heatproof non-plastic bowl on a saucepan with a small amount of simmering water. Break chocolate into pieces, add 2⁄3  to the bowl and stir until melted. Remove from heat when melted, add remaining chocolate and continue stirring until all chocolate is melted and combined.
Divide chocolate between 12 holes of a silicone muffin tray or a metal tray lined with muffin papers.
Top each with nut, seed and fruit mixture, sprinkle over salt and freeze for 1-2 hours or until set.
Store refrigerated in an airtight container.

name: Choc Hazelnut Slice
ingredients: 1 1⁄2 cups (200g) hazelnuts (peeled) soaked in hot water for 20 minutes
1⁄4 cup (20g) raw cacao powder (or cocoa powder) plus 1/2 tsp extra for dusting
1⁄2 cup (125ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Line a 8 inch x 8 inch baking tin with baking paper.
Drain hazelnuts and blend both nuts and skins in a food processor until smooth.
Add remaining ingredients and pulse until combined.
With wet hands press mixture evenly into cake tin and refrigerate for 2 hours until firm.
Cut into squares and dust with extra cocoa.
Store refrigerated in an airtight container for up to 1 week or frozen individually for up to 3 months.

name: No Bake Oat & Cranberry Bar
ingredients: 1 1⁄2 cups (150g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
1⁄4 cup (80g) brown rice syrup (honey or maple syrup)
1⁄4 cup (60g) crunchy natural peanut butter (or other nut butter)
preparation: Grease and line a 8 x 8 inch square cake tin with baking paper.
Combine oats, coconut, sultanas, cranberries and seeds in a bowl and mix well.
Heat oil, syrup and peanut butter in a small saucepan over low heat until combined.
Combine peanut butter mixture and oats and mix well. Spread into prepared tin, press down firmly and evenly and chill for 2 hours or until set.
Cut into 16 pieces and serve.

name: Frozen Yogurt Bark
ingredients: 3⁄4 cup (200g) vanilla coconut yogurt at room temperature
1 tbs maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
2 tbs (30g) 70% dark chocolate chips (or dairy-free alternative)
preparation: Line a baking sheet with baking paper.
In a medium bowl combine yogurt, maple syrup and melted coconut oil. Pour onto prepared tray.
Top with raspberries, goji berries, coconut and chocolate chips, gently pressing them into the surface.
Freeze for 2 hours or until the bark is set. Cut into squares or rough shards using a sharp knife and store in an airtight container in the freezer.

name: Coconut & Mango Cheesecake Parfait
ingredients: 2 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
preparation: Place cashews, coconut and half the honey in a small food processor and blend to a fine crumb. Divide mixture between serving glasses.
Blend cottage cheese, yogurt and remaining honey until smooth.
Spoon cheesecake filling over crumb base and top with mango. Cover and refrigerate until set.

name: Lime & Coconut Bliss Balls
ingredients: 100g cashews soaked in boiling water for 20 minutes, drained
1 cup (90g) desiccated coconut plus extra for rolling
1⁄2 cup (120ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Place cashews, coconut, almond meal, maple syrup, lime juice and half the zest in a food processor. Blend until fine and the mixture comes together.

Use wet hands to roll mixture into walnut sized balls, roll into extra coconut and sprinkle tops with remaining lime zest.

Store remainder in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 1 week.

name: Watermelon & Lime Granita
ingredients: 2 sprigs of fresh mint leaves picked
preparation: Blend frozen watermelon, lime juice and half the mint leaves in a blender until smooth.
Place in a shallow pan and freeze for 30 minutes.
Scrape frozen watermelon with a fork, transfer to tall glasses, top with mint leaves and serve immediately.

name: Smoky Popcorn
preparation: Place the popcorn in a brown paper bag and fold down the top to seal. Microwave on high for 90 seconds – 2 minutes until popped. Transfer to a bowl and discard any un-popped kernels. Add the oil and toss to coat.
Place nutritional yeast, paprika, cumin, chilli and salt in a mortar and pestle and grind to a fine powder. Sprinkle over popcorn and toss to coat in spices. Serve.

name: Mini Apple Cakes
ingredients: 1⁄4 cup (65g) honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
1 1⁄3 cups (180g) wholewheat spelt flour (or gluten free)
1 tsp ground cinnamon plus extra to dust
preparation: Preheat oven to 320°F and line a 12-hole muffin tin with muffin cases.

Combine diced apples and water in a small non-stick saucepan over medium heat and simmer for 10 minutes, or until tender and water has evaporated. Stir through honey and oil and set aside to cool slightly.
At the same time whisk together eggs and milk in a large mixing bowl. Add flour, baking powder, cinnamon and stir to combine. Fold through apple and honey mixture.
