Divide batter between muffin holes and top with sliced apple. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until cooked in the centre. Transfer to wire rack to cool completely, dust with cinnamon to serve.

Store remaining muffins in an airtight container at room temperature for 5 days or frozen for up to 3 months.

name: Lemon, Poppy Seed & Coconut Cakes
ingredients: 1⁄3 cup (80ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
1⁄3 cup (80g) coconut oil melted, plus extra for greasing
2 lemons 1/3 cup of juice, plus 2 tsp zest
preparation: Preheat oven to 320°F and grease a 12-hole muffin tin with coconut oil.
Whisk flaxseed meal and water in a large bowl and set aside for 5-10 minutes to thicken.

In another bowl whisk yogurt, maple syrup, coconut oil, lemon juice and zest, set aside. In a seperate bowl, combine flour, coconut, poppy seeds, arrowroot, baking powder and bi-carb soda and set aside.
Once flaxseed mixture has thickened, whisk in the yogurt mixture. Add dry ingredients and mix to combine.

Spoon mixture into greased tin and bake for 20-25 minutes until cooked. Cool in tin for 5 minutes. Remove cakes and transfer to a cooling rack.   

Store remaining cakes in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 3 days. Cakes can also be frozen individually for up to 2 months.

name: Golden Turmeric Milk
ingredients: 1 tbs maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Whisk all ingredients in a small saucepan and heat for 2 minutes until warm.
Pour into mugs and dust with nutmeg to serve.

name: Buffalo Cauliflower ‘Wings’
ingredients: 3⁄4 cup (190ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
1⁄2 head of cauliflower (2 lb head) cut into florets
preparation: Preheat oven to 390°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.

In a medium bowl, mix together the milk, rice flour, paprika, cayenne and garlic until smooth. Coat cauliflower florets in batter, allowing excess to drip off, and transfer to baking sheet. Bake for 20-25 minutes until golden and cooked.
Meanwhile, place yogurt in a small bowl and stir through sriracha.
Serve cauliflower and celery with sriracha yogurt on the side.

name: Dan's Caramel Date Sauce
preparation: Heat ingredients in a saucepan until barely simmering. Remove from heat and set aside for 5 minutes to infuse flavours and cool down. Carefully, blend sauce until smooth.

name: Cashew Cheese
preparation: Combine all ingredients, except water, in a food processor and pulse until broken down. Scrape mixture down from sides of blender and continue to pulse a few times to a coarse thick paste.

Continue to blend, gradually adding water, one tablespoon at a time to reach desired consistency. Season with salt and pepper, adding a little more lemon juice if needed.

Store refrigerated for up to 6 days.

name: Chocolate Anzac-Style Biscuits
ingredients: 2 cups (200g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
1⁄4 cup (60ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
40g 70% dark chocolate (or dairy-free alternative) roughly chopped
preparation: Preheat oven to 320°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.

Process half the oats, the almond meal and coconut in a food processor to a fine crumb. Add coconut oil, maple syrup, vanilla and water and pulse until the mixture is combined and sticky. Mix through remaining oats.

Using wet hands, form the mixture into 14 balls and place onto baking sheet, flattening down slightly. Transfer to oven and bake for 15 minutes. Cool on tray for 5 minutes then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.

Melt chocolate in microwave in 30 second bursts until smooth. Alternately, place chocolate in a glass bowl over a saucepan of simmering water and melt until smooth. Dip half of each biscuit into the melted chocolate and transfer to a piece of baking paper to cool at room temperature until chocolate has set.
Serve one biscuit as a snack and store remaining biscuits in an airtight container in a cool place for 3 days.

name: Double Chocolate Brownies with Caramel Sauce
ingredients: 1⁄2 cup (125ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
2 tbs raw cacao powder (or cocoa powder)
preparation: Preheat oven to 345°F and line a 8 x 8 inch square baking pan with baking paper.
In a large bowl, whisk together oil, maple syrup, eggs and vanilla extract.
Add almond meal, cacao, baking soda and salt to wet ingredients and whisk well to combine. Stir through cacao nibs and pour into pan.

Bake for 25-30 minutes or until the top is set and brownies are cooked through. They will continue to cook for a few minutes with the residual heat of the pan. Allow to cool completely before slicing (the hardest part!)

Meanwhile, to make caramel sauce, heat ingredients in a saucepan until barely simmering. Remove from heat and set aside for 5 minutes to infuse flavours and cool down. Carefully, blend sauce until smooth, pour over cooled brownies and devour!

name: Carrot Cake with Lemon Coconut Frosting
ingredients: 3 cups (405g) wholewheat spelt flour (or gluten free)
1⁄2 cup (125ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
1⁄3 cup (40g) cashews soaked overnight (or minimum 4 hours in hot water)
2 tbs maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F. Line an 8 inch round cake tin with baking paper.
In a small bowl mix ground flaxseeds with the water and place in fridge for 10 minutes, until a gelatinous consistency is formed.

In a large mixing bowl place spelt flour, baking soda, baking powder, cinnamon, nutmeg and salt, combine with a fork. Add in flaxseed mixture, coconut oil, almond milk, maple syrup and vanilla. Stir until well combined. Add carrot and walnuts and fold through mixture. Bake for 50 minutes or until an inserted skewer comes out clean.

Meanwhile make the frosting. Place drained cashews in food processor and process for 1 minute. Add coconut cream, maple syrup, lemon juice, coconut oil and salt. Combine for a further 3-4 minutes until smooth. Set aside in fridge until cake is cool.
Allow cake to cool in tin for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack. Once cool, spread frosting evenly over cake and top with extra crushed walnuts.

name: Cranberry & Pistachio Hot Cross Buns
ingredients: 1 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
3 3⁄4 cups (500g) all-purpose flour (or gluten-free if required)
2 tbs olive oil melted, extra for greasing
1⁄3 cup (40g) all-purpose flour (or gluten-free if required)
1 tbs maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
1 tbs maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Combine the yeast, maple syrup and water in a jug and stir to combine. Set aside in a warm place until mixture foams.

In a large mixing bowl add the flour, spices, cranberries, pistachios, coconut oil, water and yeast mixture, mix until combined. Lightly flour bench, turn out dough and knead for 5 minutes until smooth. Place in a lightly greased bowl, cover and sit in a warm place for one hour until doubled in size.

Line a 8 x 8 inch cake pan with baking paper and pre-heat oven to 355°F. Divide the dough into 12 even pieces, roll into smooth balls and arrange snuggly in pan. Cover and allow to rise again for a further 30 minutes.
In a small bowl mix together the paste ingredients, transfer to a piping bag and pipe a cross on each bun. Bake for 30 minutes.
For the glaze, brush hot buns with maple syrup.

name: Roasted Pears with Coconut Yogurt
ingredients: 1 cup (250ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
4 beurre bosc pears unpeeled, cut in half & core removed
preparation: Preheat oven to 475°F and roast almonds on a baking sheet for 5-10 minutes while oven is heating. Set aside.
Combine maple syrup, butter, juices, zest and spices in a roasting pan and heat for a few minutes.
Add pears cut-side down to pan and cook for 10 minutes. Turn pears over and continue to cook for another 10-15 minutes or until tender and caramelized.
Top pears with almonds and serve with coconut yogurt.

name: Bird Seed Bars
ingredients: 1 cup (100g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
1⁄4 cup (75g) crunchy natural peanut butter (or other nut butter)
2 tbs honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
preparation: Preheat the oven to 390°F and line a 10 inch x 4 inch loaf tin with baking paper.
Place oats and almonds on a baking sheet and roast for 10 minutes. Add pepitas, coconut, and flaxseeds to sheet for the last 3 minutes of cooking. Cool and transfer to a large bowl.

Add paste to remaining oat mixture along with hemp seeds and salt. Mix well with your hands and transfer to prepared tin. Place some baking paper on top, press mixture down firmly and evenly and chill for at least 3 hours and cut into bars. Boom, that’s it!

name: Peanut Butter Hemp Seed Milk
ingredients: 2 tbs peanut butter powder or peanut butter
preparation: Combine all ingredients in a blender and blend on high speed for 30 seconds, or until smooth.
Pour into a glass bottle and store milk for up to 4 days in the fridge.
Gently shake each time you remove from fridge before consuming.

name: Raw Vegan Brownies
ingredients: 350g pitted dates softened in boiling water for 10 mins, then drained
1 cup (140g) walnuts plus extra for topping
1⁄2 cup (45g) raw cacao powder (or cocoa powder)
2⁄3 cup (150g) almond butter (or other nut butter)
1⁄4 cup (20g) raw cacao powder (or cocoa powder)
2 tbs (40ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Line an 8 x 8 inch cake pan with baking paper.
Place dates in a food processor, pulse to a smooth paste and set aside.
Pulse walnuts and almonds in food processor until finely ground. Add cacao, salt and date paste and combine well to form a dough. Add a few more dates if mixture isn’t holding together.
Transfer dough to prepared pan and spread out evenly. Place in freezer for 10-15 minutes.
To make frosting, warm almond butter in a saucepan or microwave. Stir through cacao, almond milk and maple syrup and mix until well combined. You may need to add a little more milk.
Spread frosting over chilled brownie and top with extra walnuts before slicing.

name: Berry & Mango Swirl Slush
preparation: Combine berries, 1⁄2 the almond milk and 1⁄2 the ice in a blender until smooth. Pour into a glass.
Add mango and remaining almond milk and ice to blender and combine until smooth.
Gently pour over berry layer and serve.

name: DIY Trail Mix
ingredients: 80g 70% dark chocolate (or dairy-free alternative) roughly chopped
preparation: Pre-heat oven to 355°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Toss nuts with spice and spread in an even layer over tray and toast for 10 minutes.
In a medium bowl combine nuts, dates, cranberries and chocolate, toss to combine. Store in an airtight container or jar.

name: Avocado, Egg & Lettuce Cups
preparation: Place egg in a saucepan of cold water and bring to the boil. Continue to simmer for 8 minutes. Remove with a slotted spoon and place in a sink of cold water to cool, then peel.
Mash egg with cottage cheese and parsley and season to taste. Serve in lettuce leaf with sliced avocado.

name: Nutty Cookie Dough
ingredients: 1⁄4 cup (60ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
50g 70% dark chocolate (or dairy-free alternative) finely chopped
preparation: Place nuts in a food processor and blend until fine. Add maple syrup, cinnamon, oil and blend until just combined. Stir through chocolate.
Transfer mixture onto a sheet of plastic wrap on your workbench. Roll up tightly, shaping into a tight log. Twist ends to seal and refrigerate for 1 hour or until firm.
To serve, unwrap and cut into 12 even slices. Serve 1 as a snack and store remainder in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 1 week.

name: Creamy Kombucha Floats
ingredients: 2 tbs (20g) vanilla gelato (or dairy-free alternative) or ice cream
375ml kombucha berry or flavor of choice
preparation: Place gelato or ice cream in a glass and pour over kombucha.

name: Coconut, Chia & Strawberry Ice Cream Bars
ingredients: 1⁄4 cup (65ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Whisk together coconut yogurt and maple syrup until combined. Spoon only half the mixture into a small food processor, add strawberries and blend until smooth.
Add chia seeds to remaining coconut mixture and whisk to combine.
Pour the two mixtures alternately into 6 popsicle molds, swirling together with a small knife. Transfer to freezer for 4-5 hours, or until firm. Remove from molds and serve.

name: Chocolate Avocado Puddings with Raspberries
ingredients: 1 tbs almond milk (or dairy alternative) at room temperature
2 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
1 tbs fresh or frozen raspberries mashed with a fork
preparation: Place avocado, milk, maple syrup and cocoa powder in a small food processor and blend until smooth. Spoon into small glasses.
Top with yogurt and mashed raspberries. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

name: Lemon & Thyme Baked Hummus with Olives & Pita
ingredients: 1 can of chickpeas (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
4 sprigs of fresh thyme leaves stripped, plus extra for topping
2 small (2 oz ea) wholewheat pita bread or pockets (or gluten free) to serve
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F.

Combine chickpeas, tahini, thyme, garlic, lemon juice and zest, salt and pepper with water in a food processor until smooth, adjusting with more water if required. Pour into an ovenproof dish and bake for 15-20 minutes.
Brush pita with olive oil, slice into triangles and toast in the oven for 5 minutes.
Top hummus with olives, extra thyme and serve with pita.

name: Matcha & Chocolate Chip Cookies
ingredients: 1⁄3 cup (100g) honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
preparation: Preheat your oven on 300°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper. In a large bowl, combine all dry ingredients together including the chocolate chips.
In another large bowl, whisk eggs thoroughly, add melted butter and honey and whisk again until well combined.
Add wet mixture to the dry ingredients and fold to completely incorporate.
Roll tablespoons (55g or 1 1⁄2 oz) of dough into balls, gently flatten a little onto baking sheet and bake for 20-25 mins. Remove from oven and cool on sheet.

name: Peachy Panzanella Salad
ingredients: 1 thin slice(1 1/2 oz) sourdough bread (or gluten free) torn
1 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
2 sprigs of fresh basil leaves picked
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F° and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Arrange bread on sheet and bake for 5-10 minutes until golden. Cool for 10 minutes.

Place lemon juice, oil and maple in a large bowl and whisk to combine. Add peach, onion, tomatoes, arugula, basil and bread. Season with salt and pepper and gently toss to coat in dressing. Transfer to plate and serve

name: Chocolate Matcha Balls
ingredients: 1⁄2 cup (50g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
2 tsp matcha green tea powder plus extra for dusting (optional)
1 tbs maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Place dates in a small bowl and cover with hot water, allow to stand for 10 minutes to soften.
Place the oats, coconut, cocoa, cacao nibs, matcha and salt in the bowl of a food processor and blend to a fine crumb.
Drain dates, add to food processor along with maple syrup and vanilla and blend again until the mixture forms a dough. Adding a little water to bring the mixture together if required.
Using wet hands, roll the mixture into even-sized balls, lightly dust with a little matcha and refrigerate for 1 hour.
Serve 1 ball as  a snack. Refrigerate the remainder in an airtight container for up to 5 days or freeze for up to 3 months.

name: Matcha Coconut Brownies
ingredients: 1⁄3 cup (80g) almond butter (or other nut butter)
1⁄3 cup (80ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
1⁄2 cup (60g) cashews soaked in water overnight, drained
1⁄3 cup (80ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
1 tbs matcha green tea powder plus extra for dusting
preparation: Preheat oven to 320°F and line an 8 inch square baking tin with baking paper
Place all the ingredients for the brownies into a large bowl and mix well to combine. Spoon the batter into prepared tin and smooth the top. Bake for 25 minutes. Set aside to cool completely.

Place all the ingredients for the topping in a food processor and blend, scraping down the sides of the bowl, until fine. Press mixture evenly over brownie layer and put in the freezer to set for 10 minutes.

Place chocolate in a heatproof bowl and melt in microwave, stiring in 30 second intervals until smooth. Drizzle chocolate over the top. Put back into the freezer for 10 minutes then cut into 20 even pieces.
Serve 1 brownie as a snack. Store remaining brownies in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 5 days, or in the freezer for up to 1 month.

name: Fennel Cabbage Sauerkraut
ingredients: 2kg savoy cabbage outer leaves removed and set aside
2 tsp mustard seeds (or the same quantity of cilantro, fennel or cumin)
preparation: With clean hands give vegetables a really good mix.  The trick here is to mix it quite vigorously so you mix in the salt which will break down the cells of the vegetables, releasing their juices. Do this for a couple of minutes and set aside for a few minutes for the salt to do its thing. Come back to the bowl, it should now look slightly wetter than before and give it another good mix for a couple of minutes.

name: Sweet Potato Spears with Coconut Yogurt
preparation: Preheat oven to 430°F.
In a bowl, drizzle sweet potato with oil and season with sea salt, toss to coat.
Place in one layer, on a baking sheet and roast for 20-25 minutes or until crispy. Remove to cool.
Dip into coconut yogurt for a quick pre-workout snack.

name: Kiwi Matcha Pudding
ingredients: 1 tbs (20ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
1 kiwi fruit skin removed, half thinly sliced & half mashed with a fork
preparation: Place yogurt, milk, chia, maple syrup, matcha and mashed kiwi in a bowl and whisk to combine.
Place kiwi fruit slices around the sides of the glasses, add pudding, cover and refrigerate to set for 1 hour.
Top with yogurt, kiwi fruit and shaved chocolate to serve.

name: Coconut, Raspberry & Pistachio Panna Cotta Cups
ingredients: 2 tbs (40ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: In a small saucepan place coconut and almond milk, sprinkle gelatin (or agar agar) and whisk together. Allow to stand for 5 minutes.
Turn stove on to a low heat, add maple syrup and vanilla. Increase to medium heat and stir constantly until milk is hot enough to steam but is not boiling.
Divide evenly between glasses, refrigerate for 6 hours or overnight.
When ready to serve, top with raspberries and pistachios.

name: Tuna & Bean Power Bowl
ingredients: 1 can of four bean mix (14 oz can) drained
1 sprig of parsley leaves stripped & chopped
preparation: Combine ingredients in a bowl and toss lightly to combine, season with salt and pepper.
Divide between bowls or into a container, enjoy as a post-training snack.

name: Tofu & Bean Cups
ingredients: 1⁄4 can of butter beans (14 oz can) drained
1 sprig of parsley leaves stripped & chopped
preparation: Combine ingredients in a bowl and toss lightly to combine, season with salt and pepper.
Place into a cup or container, enjoy as a post-training snack.

name: Almond Milk
preparation: Soak almonds overnight in water OR place in hot water for 90 minutes.
Blend all ingredients in a high-speed blender for 2 minutes.
Strain into a wide mixing bowl using a nut milk bag, muslin fabric or cheesecloth. (Save the pulp for another recipe or use it on top of porridge or oatmeal.)
Pour into a glass bottle with a lid or cover and place in the fridge.  Will keep for 2-3 days.  Before serving, gently shake the bottle.
Add a scraped vanilla bean or some raw cacao during the blending stage for different flavours.

name: Choc Peanut Bliss Balls
ingredients: 3⁄4 cup (225g) crunchy natural peanut butter (or other nut butter)
3⁄4 cup (75g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
1⁄4 cup (20g) raw cacao powder (or cocoa powder)
preparation: Place all ingredients (except desiccated coconut) into a food processor and mix until combined.
Divide mixture into 16 equal portions. Form into balls and roll in coconut. Refrigerate for an hour before serving.

name: Gingerbread Bliss Balls
ingredients: 3⁄4 cup (80g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
1⁄3 cup (35g) desiccated coconut plus extra for rolling
3 tbs (60ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Place all ingredients in a food processor and combine until a sticky paste has formed.
Roll into tablespoon sized balls and toss in extra coconut.
Note: Refrigerate in an airtight container or freeze for up to 3 months.

name: Chris's Infinite Smoothie
preparation: Don't be gentle about it.
Get it in there.
If you drop anything, pick it up later.
Get that in your belly, immediately.
In other words, blend all ingredients until smooth & enjoy!!

name: Bounty Bites
ingredients: 3 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
90g 70% dark chocolate (or dairy-free alternative) roughly chopped
preparation: Add coconut, oil, honey and vanilla to a bowl and mix until well combined. Pour mixture into a 8 x 8 inch baking sheet lined with baking paper. Push down so mixture is compact and place in freezer for 20 minutes.
Meanwhile, to melt chocolate, place in a bowl in microwave for 30 second increments. Once melted, stir in coconut oil.

Remove sheet from the freezer and lift the slice in the baking paper onto a cutting board (that fits into the freezer) and cut into square bites. Use a toothpick to dip each square into the chocolate. Sprinkle with sea salt and place back in freezer for 5 minutes.
Store in an airtight container in the fridge for up to 5 days.

name: Tofu Ricotta
preparation: Break tofu apart and place in a food processor with other ingredients. Pulse until desired consistency reached.
Add water if more liquid required. Careful not to blend too much or you will lose the fluffiness.
Serve on toast or with crackers for a delicious snack.

name: Cheesy Corn & Quinoa Muffins
ingredients: 1⁄2 cup (90g) mixed quinoa (or other color) rinsed
1⁄2 bunch of fresh cilantro (3 oz bunch) finely chopped
3⁄4 cup (190ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
preparation: Preheat oven to 320°F and line muffin tins with 14 muffin cases.

Place quinoa, water and salt in a saucepan and bring to the boil. Lower heat and simmer, covered for 15 minutes or until just cooked. Rest covered for 5 minutes then fluff with a fork. Spread onto a tray and allow to cool.
Meanwhile, place polenta, cornstarch, baking powder, baking soda and salt in a bowl and whisk to combine. Add corn, bell pepper, cheese, cilantro and cooked quinoa. Stir to combine.
In a jug, whisk together milk, oil and eggs until combined and pour into dry ingredients. Gently fold mixture together until just combined.
Spoon mixture into the muffin cases and bake for 12-15 minutes until golden and cooked in the centre.

name: Tempeh Falafels & Mint Yogurt Sauce
ingredients: 300g plain tempeh cut into 1 inch squares
1⁄2 bunch of fresh cilantro (3 oz bunch) chopped
1⁄4 bunch of fresh flat leaf parsley (5 oz bunch) chopped
1 sprig of fresh mint finely chopped
preparation: Preheat the oven to 355°F. Line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Put all the falafel ingredients in a food processor and pulse until a dough starts to form.
Shape the dough into falafel shapes or balls, and place on baking sheet.
Bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown.
Combine the mint yogurt sauce ingredients in a bowl, mix well.
Drizzle yogurt sauce over the warm falafels to serve.

name: Bean Mix with Sweet Potato Chips
ingredients: 1⁄2 can of black beans (14 oz can) rinsed and drained
1⁄2 can of chickpeas (14 oz can) rinsed and drained
1⁄4 bunch of fresh flat leaf parsley (5 oz bunch) leaves picked and chopped
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F. Line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Toss sweet potatoes with oil, season with salt and pepper and spread over sheet. Bake for 20 minutes, flipping ‘chips’ over after 10 minutes.
Whisk dressing ingredients together, season and toss with remaining ingredients in a small bowl. Serve with sweet potato chips.

name: 'Tuna' Lettuce Cups
preparation: Add chopped celery, dill, mayonnaise and nori to a mixing bowl. Add the cooled tempeh and mix thoroughly to combine.
Finally, divide the mix between lettuce leaves, top with lime juice, capers and season to serve.

name: Blue Butterfly Pea Tisane
ingredients: 1 cup blue butterfly pea flowers, dried or 4 cups of fresh flowers
preparation: Make a simple syrup by boiling sugar, salt, pandan and water until sticky and reduced to half its original volume.
Once it has cooled but still warm to the touch, roughly 122°F, add the blue butterfly pea flowers to infuse and let steep for 30 minutes.
Strain the syrup into a bottle and store refrigerated for up to 6 months.
To serve, add 2 tsp syrup to a glass with ice cubes, lemon and lime slices and top with sparkling water, seltzer or soda water. Finish with a lemongrass swizzle stick. (Add alcohol if desired.)

name: Turkey, Apple & Cottage Cheese
ingredients: 1 Granny Smith apple cored, then sliced into discs
preparation: Top apple with cottage cheese and pre-cooked turkey breast then season with salt and pepper.

name: Italian Tuna Rice Cakes
preparation: Mix tuna, tomatoes, olives,  lemon juice in a small bowl to combine. Top rice cakes with tuna mix. Season with salt and pepper.

name: Protein Berry Yogurt
preparation: Combine protein powder with Greek yogurt and stir through mixed frozen berries. Top with chopped almonds to serve.

name: Avocado BLT
ingredients: 1 rasher of bacon (fully trimmed slice) diced
preparation: Cook bacon over medium-high heat in a non-stick skillet until cooked to your liking.
Top avocado with lettuce, tomato, bacon, cottage cheese and lemon juice. Season to taste.

name: Banana Peanut Butter Snack Smoothie
ingredients: 1⁄2 cup (125ml) milk, reduced fat (or dairy-free alternative)
1 tsp crunchy natural peanut butter (or other nut butter)
1 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Blend all ingredients until smooth. Enjoy!

name: Bay-Infused Ricotta
preparation: Place milk and bay leaves in a saucepan and heat to a temperature of 185-205°F. Turn off the heat.
Add lemon juice and stir it through gently.  Cover with a cloth and stand for 15 minutes for curds to form. Remove bay leaves.
Strain milk through a muslin-lined colander over a bowl until thickened.

Save the drained whey from the ricotta to use as a dressing or other light milk substitutes. Fresh ricotta can be used right away or refrigerated in an airtight container for up to a week, depending on the freshness of your milk.

name: Dried Fruit & Yogurt Parfait
ingredients: 1 tbs (30g) honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
20g dried apricots or dried fruit of your choice, chopped
20g 70% dark chocolate (or dairy-free alternative) shaved, to serve
preparation: Place yogurt in a bowl with the honey, salt and seeds and mix well. Layer the yoghurt mixture, berries, fruit, muesli and nuts in short glasses.
Sprinkle with chocolate.  Serve and enjoy.

name: Easy Chia Jam on Toast
ingredients: 4 thin slices (1 1/2 oz ea) wholegrain bread (or gluten free) toasted
2 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
70g fresh or frozen raspberries defrosted if frozen
2⁄3 tbs (20g) honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
preparation: Mash jam ingredients together and set aside to gel for 10 minutes.

Top toast with jam, banana slices and a drizzle of honey.
Jam can be made ahead of time and stores refrigerated for up to a week.

name: Peanut Butter Energy Bites
ingredients: 1 cup (300g) crunchy natural peanut butter (or other nut butter)
3⁄4 cup (75g) almond meal plus extra for dusting
preparation: Blend all ingredients in a food processor. Roll into balls and dust with extra almond meal.
Store in the fridge up to 2 weeks or in the freezer for 1 month.

name: Cacao-Dusted Almonds with Sea Salt
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F  and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Toss almonds with oil, scatter over sheet and bake for 5 minutes or until fragrant.
Transfer almonds to a bowl and toss with cacao and salt. Cool and serve.

name: Banana & Green Tea Ice Cream with Black Sesame Crunch
ingredients: 1 tbs black sesame seeds lightly toasted
preparation: Blend the frozen banana, avocado and matcha powder until smooth and resembling ice cream. Mix together the sesame seeds, cacao nibs and salt flakes and sprinkle over ice cream. Serve.

name: Kimchi Rice Paper Rolls
ingredients: 2 tbs (40g) smooth natural peanut butter (or other nut butter)
20ml soy sauce (or tamari if gluten free)
1 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
preparation: Dip rice paper in a shallow bowl with water to soften. Remove from bowl then layer cabbage, carrot, cucumber, bean shoots and kimchi down the centre. Fold ends then firmly roll up to enclose ingredients. Repeat with remaining ingredients.
For dipping sauce mix all ingredients together well, adding water to adjust consistency.  Serve with rolls and scatter over sesame seeds.

name: Raw Caramel Slice
ingredients: 2 tbs (40g) almond butter (or other nut butter)
1⁄3 cup (75g) almond butter (or other nut butter)
2 tbs (40ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
2 tbs (40ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Line a square 8 x 8 inch baking tin with baking paper.
For the base, place dates, almonds, coconut, almond butter, coconut oil and sea salt in a food processor and blend until fine. Use wet hands to press into the base of prepared tin and smooth the top.

For the filling, cover dates with boiling water for 10 minutes to soften then drain. Add dates, coconut oil, almond butter, milk and maple syrup into the food processor and blend until smooth. Pour onto base and transfer to refrigerator for 10 minutes to set the top.
In a small bowl, whisk together coconut oil, maple syrup and cocoa powder until smooth and combined and pour evenly over filling.
Transfer to freezer for 1-2 hours to set then cut. Serve 1 piece as snack.
Store remaining slice in an airtight container in the refrigerator or freezer for 1 week.

name: Almond Butter Protein Bars
ingredients: 1 cup (100g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
2⁄3 cup (150g) almond butter (or other nut butter)
1⁄3 cup (75ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
1⁄2 cup (90g) 70% dark chocolate chips (or dairy-free alternative)
preparation: Preheat oven to 375°F and line an 8 x 8 inch baking sheet with baking paper.
Combine all ingredients in a food processor, except for coconut flakes and chocolate chips.
Once combined, stir through flakes and chips. Press mixture into baking sheet and bake for 15 minutes or until solidified on top.
Remove from sheet and let cool, then slice into bars to serve.
Have one as a pre-workout snack!

name: Coffee Bliss Bites
ingredients: 1⁄4 cup (25g) shredded coconut toasted, plus extra for rolling
3 1⁄3 tsp (5g) instant coffee dissolved in boiling water
preparation: Combine all ingredients in a food processor to create a paste.
Roll into balls. Balls can be rolled in extra coconut to coat,  if desired.
Store bliss balls in the fridge for up to 2 weeks. One ball per serve.

name: Peanut Butter Jelly on Rice Cakes
ingredients: 4 tbs (80g) crunchy natural peanut butter (or other nut butter)
70g fresh or frozen raspberries defrosted if using frozen
2 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
preparation: Mash jam ingredients together and set aside to gel for 10 minutes.
Top rice cake with jam and a smear of peanut butter.
Jam can be made ahead of time and stores refrigerated for up to a week.

name: Roasted Carrot & Garlic Hummus
ingredients: 1 can of chickpeas (14 oz can) drained with 2 tbs liquid reserved
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F. Line a baking tray with baking paper.
Toss carrots and garlic with oil, season with salt and pepper and bake for 15 minutes.
When carrot and garlic are ready, add to a food processor with all other hummus ingredients including chickpea liquid, and combine until smooth. Be sure to remove skins from garlic before blending.
Spread hummus across a plate and top with vegetable toppings.

name: Avocado Hummus Dip with Pita
ingredients: 1 can of chickpeas (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
1⁄4 cup (60g) tzatziki (or dairy-free alternative) or Greek yogurt & pinch garlic powder
2 tbs lemon juice or more to taste
1⁄4 bunch of fresh cilantro (3 oz bunch) or other fresh herbs, roughly chopped
2 small (2 oz ea) wholewheat pita bread or pockets (or gluten free) fresh or toasted, cut into triangles
preparation: Blend chickpeas, tzatziki and lemon juice in a food processor or blender until smooth.
Add avocado and cilantro and pulse to combine, without over blending. Add more lemon juice if required and season with salt and pepper.
Serve with pita bread or with your favorite vegetable crudites.

name: Kale & Brazil Nut Pesto Dip
ingredients: 1 bunch of fresh basil (5 oz bunch) (approx. 3/4 oz) leaves picked
1 1⁄2 bunches of fresh flat leaf parsley (5 oz bunch) (approx. 1 1/2 oz) leaves picked
1 bunch of kale (14 oz bunch) (approx. 8 oz) stems removed
Serve with your choice of vegetable crudites
preparation: Combine all ingredients, except olive oil, in a food processor, until a loose paste forms.
Add in olive oil to reach desired consistency. If needed, add small amounts of water if mixture is too thick.
Serve with vegetable crudites.

name: Almond Butter Balls
ingredients: 1⁄2 cup (50g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
1⁄4 cup (60g) almond butter (or other nut butter)
preparation: Pulse dates in a food processor until mix comes together in a ball. Add oats, almond butter, chocolate and chia seeds and process until combined.
Roll into tablespoon sized balls and set in the freezer for 15 minutes.
Keep fresh in an airtight container for up to a week, or freeze for 3 months.

name: Nutty Granola Bars
ingredients: 3⁄4 cup (80g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
2 tbs almond butter (or other nut butter)
1⁄4 cup (60ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: Preheat oven to 350°F and line a 8 x 8 inch square tin with baking paper.
Arrange oats and almonds on a baking sheet. Bake for 10-15 minutes or until slightly toasted. Remove. Reduce oven heat to 320°F.
Combine milled flaxseed, desiccated coconut, and sea salt in a large mixing bowl. Add dates, toasted oats, and almonds, and stir together.
Place almond butter, coconut oil, and maple syrup into a small saucepan and bring to the boil, stirring well.  Remove from heat, pour into dry mixture and combine thoroughly.
Spread mixture evenly into lined tin, pressing down until flat. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until the edges are golden brown. Remove from oven and allow to cool.
Meanwhile, in a bowl melt chocolate in microwave in 30 second increments.
Once slice has cooled, use a spoon to drizzle chocolate over top. Cut into bars.

name: Chocolate Raspberry Mousse
ingredients: 1 can of chickpeas (14 oz can) drained to use the liquid only (aquafaba)
1⁄3 cup (30g) raw cacao powder (or cocoa powder) plus extra for dusting
1 tbs maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
1⁄2 cup (70g) fresh or frozen raspberries pulsed in a blender to form a thick sauce
preparation: Drain chickpeas over mixing bowl to use the liquid (aquafaba) only. Rinse and store chickpeas for another recipe.
Beat aquafaba using an electric mixer on high speed for 10 minutes, until white and glossy and soft peaks form.
In a separate bowl combine coconut oil,  cacao powder and maple syrup together until smooth.
Gently fold chocolate mixture into aquafaba until well combined.
Evenly distribute mixture into small glasses or ramekins and set in the fridge for 4-6 hours.
Once set, dust extra cacao over the top and spoon over raspberry sauce.

name: Choc Tahini & Date Bliss Balls
ingredients: 1 tbs raw cacao powder (or cocoa powder) for rolling
preparation: Place almonds, coconut, protein powder, tahini, dates, salt and cinnamon in a food processor and combine until a sticky coarse mixture has formed.
Add cacao nibs and water to help bind.  Once a sticky and semi-smooth mixture has formed, roll into 1 tbs sized balls. Roll each ball in cacao powder. Place in refrigerator to set for 2-3 hours.

name: Apple & Cinnamon Biscuits
ingredients: 1⁄3 cup (40g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
1 tsp ground cinnamon plus extra for dusting
1⁄4 cup (60ml) buttermilk plus extra for brushing
1⁄4 cup (60ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
1⁄2 cup (125g) Greek yogurt (or dairy-free alternative) to serve
preparation: Preheat oven to 320°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Pulse flour, oats, cinnamon and baking soda in a food processor to form a fine crumb. Transfer to a large bowl and mix through diced apple.
Whisk together apple sauce, buttermilk, maple syrup and egg.
Add wet mixture to dry ingredients and mix until just combined
Turn dough out onto a floured bench and form into a thick disc shape just about 1 1⁄4 inches thick. Cut out scones with a 2 1⁄2 inch cookie cutter and transfer to baking sheet.
Brush scones with extra buttermilk and bake for 15 minutes or until lightly golden.
Top scones with 2 tsp of yogurt and a dusting of cinnamon to serve.
Store in an airtight container for up to 3 days or  frozen for up to 3 months.

name: Peanut Butter Soft Serve with Choc Magic Topping
ingredients: 2 tbs coconut yogurt (or dairy alternative) frozen
1 tbs crunchy natural peanut butter (or other nut butter)
1 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
preparation: Place serving glass in the freezer for 5 minutes to chill.
To make topping, mix oil and cocoa in a small bowl until combined. Drizzle half the topping around the inside of serving glass.

Place banana and yogurt into a small food processor and blend until smooth. Add peanut butter and honey and blend again until smooth and combined. Spoon into serving glass and drizzle over choc topping. Serve.

name: Banoffee Parfait
ingredients: 2 tsp maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
preparation: For the date caramel, place the dates in a jug, cover with water and allow to stand for 10 minutes until dates are soft. Add vanilla and blitz in a food processor to make a smooth sauce. Set aside.
Place almonds and coconut in a dry skillet over medium heat and toast for 1-2 minutes until golden. Allow to cool.
Place the almonds, coconut and maple syrup in a food processor and pulse until fine, then set aside 2 teaspoons of nut crumb for the top.

Evenly divide half of the crumb into glasses. Divide half the banana over the top and spoon over half the date caramel, followed by half the yogurt. Repeat layering with crumb, banana, caramel and yogurt.

Top parfait with a final drizzle of caramel, a slice of banana and reserved crumb.

Note: Parfaits can be made the day before and left covered overnight in the refrigerator.

name: Peanut Butter Oat Cookies
ingredients: 1⁄3 cup (80ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
1⁄4 cup (75g) smooth natural peanut butter (or other nut butter)
1 1⁄4 cups (125g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
preparation: Preheat oven to 320°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Place coconut oil, maple syrup, peanut butter and banana in a large bowl and mix well to combine. Add oats, almond meal, coconut, cinnamon, peanuts and currants and mix well to combine.

Roll heaped tablespoons of mixture into balls and place on prepared sheet. Press down slightly to flatten then bake for 15 minutes until lightly golden. Cool completely then serve 1 cookie as a snack.
Store remaining cookies in an airtight container at room temperature for 5 days.

name: Coconut, Date & Nut Bites
ingredients: 2 tbs almond butter (or other nut butter)
2 tbs honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
preparation: Preheat oven to 320°F and line a 8 x 8 inch baking tin with baking paper.
Place dates in a small bowl and cover with boiling water, allow to stand for 10 minutes to soften.
Warm oil, almond butter and half the honey in a small saucepan or microwave to combine.

Combine almonds, a third of the coconut, flour, baking powder, cinnamon and salt in a food processor and blend until fine. Add almond butter mix and blend until combined. Transfer to prepared baking tin and press down firmly to create an even base.
Reserve 1⁄4 cup of the water from the dates and discard the rest. Transfer dates and reserved water to a small food processor. Blend until smooth then spread evenly over the base.
Place the remaining honey in a medium bowl and microwave for 15 seconds or until runny. Add remaining coconut and cashews and stir to combine. Sprinkle evenly over date puree, pressing down lightly.
Bake for 25 minutes or until golden. Allow to cool completely in tin before removing and cutting into 16 bites.
Store remaining bars in an airtight container in the refrigerator for 5 days.

name: Mango & Coconut Slushy
ingredients: 1 sprig of fresh mint leaves stripped, to serve
preparation: Place mango, yogurt, desiccated coconut and coconut water in a blender and blend on high until smooth and thick.
Pour into a glass and serve topped with coconut flakes and mint leaves.

name: Grilled Pineapple with Cinnamon
ingredients: 250g pineapple peeled & cut lengthwise into wedges (triangles)
1 sprig of fresh mint leaves picked
1 tsp honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
6 bamboo skewers soaked in water for 30 mins
preparation: Heat a barbecue or non-stick grill pan over high heat.
Thread pineapple wedges onto skewers.
Grill for 3-4 minutes a side, turning, until charred and tender. Squeeze over fresh lime juice and sprinkle with mint.
Transfer to plates and drizzle with honey. Serve warm.

name: Chickpea Choc Chip Blondie
ingredients: 1 can of chickpeas (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
150g crunchy natural peanut butter (or other nut butter)
1⁄4 cup (25g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
1⁄3 cup (100g) honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup) warmed
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F and line a 8 x 8 inch baking tin with baking paper.

Blend all ingredients, except choc chips, in a food processor and puree until smooth. Gradually add sufficient water to help loosen mixture a little and scrape down the sides. Pour batter into prepared tray, scatter over choc chips, and press gently over the surface.
Bake for 25 minutes, or until slice feels firm to touch and mixture is pulling away from the sides. Don’t be tempted to overcook, they will set more on cooling.
Once cool, cut into 12 squares.

name: Green Matcha Bars
ingredients: 1⁄3 cup (100g) crunchy natural peanut butter (or other nut butter)
2 tbs honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
2 cups (200g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
preparation: Lightly grease and line an 8 x 8 inch baking tin with baking paper and set aside 1 tablespoon of pumpkin seeds for later.
Heat coconut oil, peanut butter and honey in a saucepan over medium heat and stir for 1-2 minutes until warmed through and combined. Whisk in matcha powder.

Place oats, puffed rice, pepitas and sultanas in a large bowl. Pour over matcha mixture and mix well to combine. Press firmly into tin and sprinkle with reserved pumpkin seeds. Refrigerate at least 2 hours until firm. It's important you use the correct-sized tin to press the mixture into in order for it be compact enough not to fall apart.

Melt chocolate in microwave, or in a glass bowl over a saucepan of simmering water. Use a spatula to scrape the chocolate into a piping bag (or use a fork) to drizzle chocolate over bars. Allow to cool again at room temperature until chocolate is set then slice into bars.
Serve 1 bar as snack and store remaining bars in an airtight container in the refrigerator for 5 days.

name: Cranberry & Almond Rock Cakes
ingredients: 2 tbs maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
1 cup (135g) all-purpose flour (or gluten-free if required)
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Mix chia seeds with water and set aside for 15 minutes to thicken.
Meanwhile, place half the coconut oil and maple syrup in a saucepan over medium heat and stir for 1-2 minutes until warmed through.

Place slivered almonds, flour, cranberries, orange zest and chia mixture in a bowl. Add remaining coconut oil and mix well to combine. Place heaped tablespoons of mixture onto prepared baking tray. Brush over maple syrup to form a glaze.
Bake for 20-25 minutes until lightly golden and the edges are crunchy. Cool.
Serve 1 rock cake as a snack and store remaining cakes in an airtight container for 3 days.

name: Crunchy Cacao & Hazelnut Bars
ingredients: 1⁄3 cup (100g) almond butter (or other nut butter)
1⁄4 cup (60g) brown rice syrup (honey or maple syrup)
1⁄3 cup (30g) raw cacao powder (or cocoa powder) reserve 1 tsp for dusting
4 tbs (20g) freeze-dried raspberries or strawberries blitzed to a crumb
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F and line a 8 x 8 inch baking tin with baking paper.

Place hazelnuts on another baking tray and roast for 7-10 minutes. Remove from oven and place in a clean tea towel, rub together to remove as much skin as possible. Allow hazelnuts to cool then finely chop.
Place coconut oil, almond butter and brown rice syrup in a saucepan over medium heat and stir for 2-3 minutes until warmed and combined. Remove from heat and whisk in vanilla and cacao powder.

Place puffed rice, cacao nibs, salt and chopped hazelnuts in a large bowl and pour cacao mixture over, mixing well to combine. Press firmly into prepared tin, smooth over the top and dust with extra cacao, and freeze-dried raspberries. Refrigerate for 1 hour or until set.
Cut into bars. Serve 1 bar as snack and store remaining in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 5 days.

name: Morning Recovery
ingredients: 20g natural corn chips (low salt) to serve
preparation: Place tomato and lemon juice, sauces and ice in a jug and stir to combine. Season with salt and pepper.
Pour into a glass, garnish with celery stick and serve with corn chips as a snack.

name: Veggie Chips
preparation: Preheat oven to 390°F and line two baking sheets with baking paper.
Combine parmesan and paprika in a large bowl.
Using a mandoline, slice the vegetables into paper-thin rounds and add to bowl. Toss well with parmesan and paprika to coat and spread over baking sheets, without overlapping.
Cook for 15-20 minutes, or until cooked and slightly crisp.
Season with salt and pepper to serve.

name: Monte Carlo Snack Smoothie
ingredients: 1 tsp rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
preparation: Combine all ingredients in a blender until smooth.

name: Peanut Caramel Cups
ingredients: 1⁄2 cup (140g) crunchy natural peanut butter (or other nut butter)
1 1⁄3 tbs (40g) brown rice syrup (honey or maple syrup)
1⁄3 cup (30g) raw cacao powder (or cocoa powder)
preparation: Prepare 12 holes of a mini muffin tin with muffin cases.
Place dates and water in food processor, combine until a paste forms. Add peanut butter, coconut oil and almond milk and process until combined.
To make the chocolate, melt coconut oil in a small saucepan over low heat. Add syrup and stir well. Add cacao and whisk to combine.
Spoon 1 tsp of chocolate into muffin cases and place in freezer to set for 5 minutes.
Then divide peanut caramel mixture between cups and fill with remaining chocolate to cover filling.
Freeze for 2 hours, remove from tray and store in and airtight container in the fridge or freezer.

name: Edamame Hummus & Cucumber Sticks
ingredients: 1⁄2 Lebanese cucumber deseeded & cut into batons
preparation: Place edamame, tahini, lemon juice, cumin, garlic and cilantro in a small food processor and blend until combined. Add water to thin if required and blend again.
Season with salt and pepper. Transfer to serving bowl and sprinkle with sesame seeds. Serve hummus as snack with cucumber.
Store remaining hummus covered in refrigerator for 2 days.

name: Moroccan Spiced Chickpeas
ingredients: 1 can of chickpeas (14 oz can) drained & rinsed
1 1⁄2 tsp Moroccan spice mix (or Ras el hanout-a mixture of cumin, coriander, paprika, ginger, turmeric)
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F and line a baking sheet with baking paper.
Place the chickpeas on some paper towel and roll around to dry chickpeas. Transfer to sheet and drizzle over oil, rolling chickpeas around to coat. Sprinkle with salt.
Bake for 45 minutes, stirring halfway through, until deep golden and crunchy. Remove from oven and sprinkle over Moroccan spice mix, tossing to coat evenly. Allow to cool completely on sheet.
Store chickpeas in a container at room temperature for 5 days.

name: Peanut Butter & Strawberry Jelly Bites
ingredients: 1⁄4 cup (60ml) maple syrup (honey or rice malt syrup)
1⁄3 cup (100g) crunchy natural peanut butter (or other nut butter)
1 cup (135g) all-purpose flour (or gluten-free if required)
preparation: Preheat oven to 320°F and line a 8 x 4 inch loaf tin with baking paper.

To make the jelly, place strawberries and lemon juice in a small non-stick saucepan over medium heat and cook, stirring, for 3-4 minutes until liquid is released and strawberries become soft. Add chia seeds and stir to combine. Set aside.

To make the dough, place coconut oil, maple syrup and peanut butter in the bowl of an electric mixer and beat until smooth and combined. Add almond meal and flour and beat on low until combined. Press two thirds of the mixture evenly into the base of tin. Bake for 15 minutes.

Remove from oven and spread over strawberry jelly. Break up remaining mixture into pieces and crumble over the jelly, then sprinkle with peanuts. Bake for 15 minutes until golden. Cool completely in the tin then transfer to board and cut.
Serve 1 bite as snack and store remaining in an airtight container for 3 days. Bites can also be frozen for 3 months.

name: Chocolate Banana Gelato
ingredients: 1 tbs almond butter (or other nut butter)
1 tbs raw cacao powder (or cocoa powder)
preparation: Blend all ingredients until smooth. Divide between bowls or glasses and serve immediately.

name: Coconut Caramel Bliss Balls
ingredients: 4 tbs (40g) rolled oats (or brown rice flakes or quinoa flakes if gluten free)
preparation: Place dates in a small bowl, cover with boiling water and set aside for 10 minutes.
Drain dates, saving 1 tbs of liquid and add to a food processor. Blend until smooth and  caramel-like.
Add remaining ingredients (keeping 4 tbs coconut aside) to food processor. Mix until oats break down and mixture binds together, adding liquid from dates if needed.
Using a tablespoon, scoop out mixture and roll into balls. Roll balls in coconut and store in an airtight container in the fridge.

name: Carrot, Seed & Honey Muffins
ingredients: 1 1⁄2 cups (205g) wholewheat spelt flour (or gluten free)
2 tbs (60g) honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
preparation: Preheat oven to 355°F and line a 24 hole mini muffin tin with muffin cases.
Combine flour, baking powder and ginger in a medium sized mixing bowl.
Warm butter and honey in small saucepan or microwave until just melted.
Whisk eggs, yogurt and vanilla in a small mixing bowl, until smooth. Add combined butter and honey and stir through.
Add wet mixture to dry ingredients and mix well to combine. Gently fold carrot through mixture and spoon into prepared muffin cases.
Combine pepitas and kernels in a small bowl and sprinkle over muffins. Bake for 15-20 minutes, until cooked through and an inserted skewer comes out clean.
Cool muffins in tray for a few minutes before removing and transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

name: Berry Granola Summer Popsicles
ingredients: 1 tbs honey (brown rice syrup or maple syrup)
preparation: Combine yogurt, vanilla and honey together in a bowl. Gently fold berries and granola through.
Divide mixture between popsicle moulds, insert popsicle sticks and freeze for 4 hours or until frozen.
Enjoy in the summer sun!
